Review: Great smell and makes my hair soft but I have used sulfate free shampoo for years and I have to use a lot more of the product than others.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Color Hair Beware
Review: Great shampoo and it smells fantasticHowever I have purple hair and was recommended that this would help with minimizing my hair dye washing out. Using this washes out my color just as much as using argan oil shampoos but less than other conventional shampoos. I would use this shampoo but different conditioner if you have colored hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Not rich enough.
Review: Smells nice, but I understand I need 4xs as much to get a good lather compared to the L'Oréal shampoo I usually buy.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Too heavy
Review: This shampoo and conditioner combo is too heavy for my hair type. But if you have dry hair, I think it would really help moisturize. My hair isn't particularly dry. This stuff smells really good and the smell lasts a long time on my hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Left hair brittle, dry and unmanageable. Horrible!!'
Review: Okay so there are a few things I really enjoy about this shampoo and the smell is one of them...and thats about it. I have caucasion hair thats is color treated, i wanted to try this brand because it's sulfate free. First thing i noticed is a little went a long way and at first it was great but after a few seconds my hair was like in a rats nest and it become hard and straw like to where I couldn't get my fingers through my hair, i took a while to rinse it all out. Once i towel dried my hair I was shocked to see it made it hard, super super dry and brittle. I purposely didn't use condition because i wanted to test the product by itself. Once my hair it was a giant hard frizzy puff and i have straight sleek hair naturally. It's nowhere near close to being a mild cleanser it's very strong and stripped all good oil out. I had to take another shower and use john frieda to reverse the damage. I wanted this to work so bad but I've honestly never seen a shampoo destroy hair like that.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Four Stars
Review: Good, but pricey....

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I LOVE this brand and everything they produce
Review: I LOVE this brand and everything they produce. This shampoo cleans my hair and makes it shiny and soft. I love the fact that there is no sulfate in it. Smells amazing and it lathers good.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: disgusting gook
Review: theres something wrong with this product ..  turns into a thick gook  and cant be used  ...  ive used this shampoo for years and the past 2 times buying  it had to throw it away  - perhaps it the company thats selling it where the issue is

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: NOT FOR MY CURLY HAIR TODDLER
Review: I purchased this shampoo for my toddler who is bi racial with curly hair. It dried my daughters curls out. I heard about Carol's daughter products off YouTube wanted to see what all the hype was about don't buy it. I started using it on my hair just not to let it go to waste.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Horrible shampoo
Review: I used this shampoo on my 3b curls once a week for a month.  By the third week it made my curls course and difficult to comb out.  I should have stopped using it but decided to try one more time. My hair was a tangled mess that took forever to comb out resulting in more than normal hair loss. I will never buy again.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Love the scent
Review: Smells delicious!

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: A really beautiful product and not just for coarse, frizzy, curly hair. For all kinds of hair!
Review: Carol's daughter products are made for hair that is coarser and curly - mine is straight fine blond hair, and I love this Shampoo and Conditioner. It makes my hair feel clean, smell great and look quite shiny. I have purchased this several times, as well as other items from the same line. No sulphates is really nice, as sulphates are so drying. You do not get as many suds, but it does suds up a bit and your hair will look fabulous!Also, this line does not have parabens (wax) or silicone in any of their products. I used to use products that had this stuff in it and it did make my hair look good - it coats the hair and keeps the cuticle down, BUT the waxes are hard and make the hair brittle and there is more breakage.I only buy and use products that do not have silicone or parabens - Carol's Daughter is great for my fine, blonde, straight hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Not secured well
Review: The shampoo was leaking in the bag. The top was not secured well enough.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Three Stars
Review: It is not moisturizing enough for normal and healthy hairs.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: One Star
Review: Make my hair very dry

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Five Stars
Review: good

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: FAKE!!!!
Review: I think this is counterfeit. Does not smell like vanilla and does not lather.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: This product changed my hair texture, and caused major hair loss
Review: I recieved the whole Carol's Daughter line as a Christmas gift, and I was very excited to start using it. I stopped all my other hair care products, because I wanted to get the full experience. When I first put the Black Vanilla shampoo on my hair I noticed right away that my hair felt tangled and matted. I proceeded with the conditioner and my hair felt really nice, and the slip was good. After washing out the conditioner my hair was rough, matted and tangled. I used the mimosa hair dressing and curl creme. Days after, my hair was dry and still very rough. I decided to keep using it and figured my hair needed to get used to it. The end of Feburary ('20), after washing and using the conditioner my hair fell out in clumps, my edges are gone and my hair is thin and still tangled and rough. I also no longer have the same curly hair texture, my curls are gone. I was devastated because I wanted to like this product and give it a chance. My hair was to the middle of my back, and now it barely touches my shoulders. I "had" a head full of strong, thick, natural, healthy curly hair and had never experienced this with any product before. I normally dont write reviews, but figured this review may have been experienced by someone else. Although majority of people may have good experiences, I was one of the few that didn't have that opportunity to say this worked. I will no longer use Carol's Daughter, but I'm also not trying to discourage others from trying it.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great smell, but didn’t work for my hair
Review: So I hate that I have to give this stars in order to post a review because the product isn’t bad, it’s just not right for me/my hair. I have color treated hair and this shampoo and conditioner dried it out so much that for the first time in my life I had itchy scalp and dandruff. The smell is amazing which is important to me as someone who has issues with scent. I like that it doesn’t have a lot of crap in it that’s bad for your hair, but I think it’s just not meant for color treated hair. I didn’t like that I needed a lot to get a decent lather, but that is preference, not necessarily a bad thing about the product. While my scalp got dried out, my hair did feel soft, but it changed the texture enough that I had difficulty styling it the way I usually do. I would just recommend that if you have color treated hair to steer clear.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Somewhat Comparable to Redken All Soft In Terms of Results
Review: This is an all-around good shampoo that leaves my color-treated hair feeling clean, but not overly stripped, or the opposite which is probably worse (gummy and heavy with buildup, as cheap shampoos tend to do). It's pleasantly scented like warm vanilla...it leans a little toward the feminine side for sure, but it's subtle enough once it dries that a bro could use it. The pump bottle is convenient, although mine leaks quite a bit if it's not held upright. For comparison, I typically use Redken All Soft which is twice the price, and while I wouldn't say this is every bit as good (my hair doesn't feel quite as soft or totally frizz-free as with All Soft), it's close enough that I would buy it again, or maybe alternate it with All Soft to get more mileage out of each bottle. With a quick smoothing treatment after straightening, you probably wouldn't be able to tell a difference. I used this in conduction with the Black Vanilla Hair Smoothie, which I would rate higher than the shampoo....both products were the first time I'd tried Carol's Daughter products, and I am pleased.UPDATE: After using this product exclusively for a few weeks, my hair is drier, frizzier, and more difficult to brush. I don't think I'll repurchase.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Soft hair
Review: My body's age reached 51 and I found my hair is bit dryer and not as shinny. I am also allergic to scents. I have tried many organic, higher end brands. This one restored my hair's shine. is soft after washing. I used it for 7 times now, no allergy. I will try it for longer but so far I am in love. so I bought one more and brought it to homeless shelter.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Cleans 4a/4b low porosity hair without intense drying
Review: Preface: Now I've been getting mine from walmart, but I'm adding my review here as I've added it to my hair care list.I have 4a/4b low porosity hair, so I've been struggling with dryness since fall began.I picked this up with the conditioner after trying their combing creme, which I adore. All the products in this line smelling amazing, it makes my scalp feel so nice and everything gets clean without getting overly dry. And I'm thankful it doesn't take so much. My husband was nervously staring at his wallet for a while. I've used it a few times now since I bought it and it's not even halfway like most of my other shampoos would be.Now I'm not saying my hair feels super moisturized and soft after this shampoo. It still cleans everything off like it's supposed to. But I don't end up feeling like steel wool, ok? The conditioner in this line is lovely~

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Hair loss
Review: Currently only using the shampoo but, I'm convinced it is what's causing me to have major hair loss. I enjoy the black vanilla smell and think the shampoo washes well. The conditioner was not hydrating at all and found my hair to be more dry and brittle then EVER!I'm at the last quarter of the bottle and just don't want to keep trying.. 😞So sad I had high hopes with the claims they make and other product reviews

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Smells spectacular!
Review: Used this today for the first time, both shampoo and conditioner. The reviews are true, it really does smell AMAZING. I kept getting wafts of vanilla as I moved around. My hair is soft and smells nice. I didn't have any issues getting the shampoo to lather. I have wavy hair, and after brushing it and letting it air dry...the texture seemed different. Maybe a bit less frizz (but not a lot). I expect good things for styling my hair after using this. I bought it because my mom is called Carol, and I was looking for a sulfate free combo.FYI Wal-Mart sells this in the Ethnic Hair section for just under $10 a bottle.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Booooo! Hissssssss!
Review: Literally the very worst shampoo I have ever used. The bottle claims to add 80% more moisture. I don’t know for who, because it stripped my hair of moisture so badly that I will be lucky not to have to bc it. I purchased it, along with the conditioner and mask from the Carol's Daughter website. I call foul, because I tried to leave a review about my poor experience with all 3 products, & they refused to publish it. I seriously question that anyone actually has good experiences with these products.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Use Less fragrance!
Review: This shampoo is very moisturizing and cleans well. I've used a variety of CD shampoos and I think they are the best sulfate-free shampoos on the market- some can feel a little drying but all clean very well. This shampoo provides most of the moisture in the black vanilla line, which is sealed in by the conditioner. It would be better if they didn't use fragrance though or at least as much as they do. Fragrance is very high on the ingredients list, which scares me since I know there are many chemicals in fragrance that can irritate the scalp and possibly cause hair loss. Unfortunately, if you want to use the conditioner you should also use this shampoo for best results.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Made my hair feel like straw
Review: I am a Black Woman with 4a/4b textured hair, and had been in need of a moisturizing shampoo and conditioner. Initially I was out to purchase Giovanni because of all of the rave reviews, but opted for this product.Every claim it was supposed to fulfill, it did the opposite of. The shampoo stripped my hair, in turn tangling it very badly. I had hoped the conditioner would repair the issue, but it did nothing of the sort. Left my hair so stringy and knotted, I had to go out and buy another shampoo and conditioner (Aussie Moist) to make up for what this didn't do, which worked out much better for me.I wouldn't recommend this product for those with kinky and/or curly hair, given our hair doesn't produce as much oil as those with straighter hair. So it may strip your hair of all the moisture it needs while also failing to compensate for the loss of moisture.(Also: I had watched a review on YouTube by DSFAVORS and read the responses. I wished I had checked it out prior to purchasing, because apparently I'm not the only one with such horrible results.)

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Promises made but not delivered
Review: I had to add tons of "It's a 10" to salvage my shampoo day. This was drying and absolutely not moisturizing.Regrets, Ive had a few and CD's black Vanilla line is one of them.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Hair in need of love?
Review: I am from Scottish and Mexican descent. My hair has always been super thick, super black and always frizzy. Recently I've been trying EVERYTHING! Why do I have this horrible hair that does nothing but make me hot and looks like I have a giant poodle on my head? Why can't I have soft flowy non frizzy hair? And can for the love of everything holy, can the ends STOP feeling like straw? I could probably scratch you with the ends of my hair. So dry. And the shampoos and conditioning that say "moisture"... Lies! All lies! My hair is as thirsty as that girl that's throwing herself at every guy in the bar. The only difference though... My hair gets nothing. Not even a promise of any of those things I listed above. I just don't understand what's wrong with my hair! I've tried dove, garnier, tresme, salon grade stuff... Ogx and stuff from lush the list goes on and on. My co worker the other day looks at me and says " you have that thick coarse Mexican Indian hair." Me "yea.. And it's horrible". She then tells me to use this stuff. And I'm like but that's not made for my type of hair. And she looks at me "Don't fool yourself, your hair is just as bad as mine used to be." But my coworkers hair is so shiny and looks well behaved. And it looks like it's "in place". Me " whaa? You? Your hair is so pretty though". So I go to Target and buy this stuff. It's with all the natural hair products, the section that I've never shopped in because well it's for natural hair and I'm far from that hair type. So I thought. I buy the shampoo and conditioner, jump in the shower. I love the smell right? Okay. But will you make my hair soft? And hydrated? Because nothing has worked! The shampoo is thick and it almost feels like a conditioner, it's a dark Amber color and I smear it all over my hair. Thick and dry and Tangled. And it doesn't lather so good but I continue working into my scalp. Rinse and follow with step two. It's thick and creamy and coats my locks. I leave it in for like maybe 5 min and continue with my shower. I rinse get out, and that's when the magic happens. Yes. Magic! Why?! Because when my hair was 70%dry I could already feel a BIG HUGE difference... I could run my fingers through my hair! Run them right through. OMG! It's been known to snap hair brushes in half on multiple occasions. But here I am combing my fingers through​ my hair. All day, listen all day my hair is calm it's shiny it feels light weight which is a first in the 28 years on this Earth it feels light weight! OMG who's hair is this? It looks like I blow dried it straight with a slight wave but there is absolutely no kinks no frizz and it's shiny. I actually cried. It's been forever my whole life I thought I had bad hair. No. Bad products. Period. Im already in love with the product and I will invest in this line. Thank you to whom ever made this and thank you to my co worker. OMG best thing she's ever told me. Buy this. Buy this if you're white, brown, black, yellow red whatever... You have hair that you think is bad... Buy this! Right now. Just hit that buy now button! Or go to the store, this is everywhere! Why wait? Buy it!

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Best sulfate free & moisture rich shampoo!
Review: I am completely obsessed with this shampoo & conditioner! I switched to sulfate free shampoo three years ago and this is by far the best I have ever used. It lathers like a regular SLS shampoo and rinses clean. After just 3 washes I could really see a difference in the softness of my hair. I live in Colorado and keeping my hair moisturized can be a seriously difficult task but this shampoo and conditioner has changed my life! Sounds dramatic, I know. But this is some good stuff!

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: For Vanilla Lovers!
Review: I love the fragrance of this shampoo. The first time I used it I was a bit disappointed with the lather and worried that it would not clean my hair and scalp well. It did do a nice job however. I am pleased with the performance of the product. I would strongly suggest using it in tandem with its conditioner. The next day my hair was softer and more manageable than it has been with other, more expensive, shampoos. I will be making this a regular purchase.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I'm hooked!!
Review: Just started using this stuff a week or so ago. It is so mildly cleansing so is is safe for my bleached blonde, curly, biracial hair and my sulfate allergy. No itching, no scalp irritation and leaves my hair moisturized but clean. This stuff is so natural that it doesn't leave much scent/fragrance on your hair so you might smell..human rather than like perfume. Which is what I very much prefer, otherwise I don't feel cleaned, just covered up with extra fragrance. That being said, it smells AMAZING. Gentle enough so I can wash my hair more often and not worry about overly drying.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Its a terrible product very poor on advertising  it!
Review: It completely  dries ur hair out so bad you notice while washing . It stripped my shine completely.  I wouldn't  ever recommend  it .

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great shampoo, conditioner, too!
Review: I love this shampoo in conjunction with the conditioner... it's probably designed for coils and kinks more than looser curls and waves, but the moisture is amazing for any type of curl, without weighing them down. The only thing I don't really like now after six months of use is the fragrance.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Horrible. Ruined my hair
Review: I have fine Caucasian hair. I hoped the conditioner will moisturize my hair because of all the promising ingrendients.But it made my hair even more dull looking and dried it out. Also it leaves a film on my hair as if I haven't washed it in days. It looked frizzy and broken after a 2 week trial.I had to go to the hair dresser to fix my hair again.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: It did make my hair feel nice, but just couldn't deal with the smell
Review: Got this as a sample and tried both the shampoo and conditioner.  The scent was just too strong for me.  I there are people who will appreciate this, but I am not one.  I do usually use a sulfate-free shampoo and conditioner and was looking forward to trying this.  It did make my hair feel nice, but just couldn't deal with the smell....it was terror on my sinuses.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great Shampoo
Review: This is the best shampoo I have ever used. Thanks to my Greek/Irish ancestry my hair is a combination of thick, wavy, fine, and frizzy. I have quite a bit of hair but this shampoo seems to be concentrated as I only need about half the amount I usually use. Don't expect a bunch of suds. I even forgot to condition one morning and my hair was still frizz free, soft, and shiny all day.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: two scrubs= amazing hair. Gets it clean
Review: Everything I look for in a shampoo. Sulfates and other scary words free, doesnt test on animals.It lasted me about 4 month's. I was my hair about every 3 days. My hair is fineish, straightish, naturally blond but dyed. I wash it when its really oily. One scrub= 90% oil free, two scrubs= amazing hair.Gets it clean, keeps it healthy

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: but disappointed so far
Review: This arrived leaking and the liquid separated into two layers within the bottle. It is super hard to recombine it I used a ton just to feel clean and my hair was really frizzy. Which is not normal for me with other shampoos. Tried it for several weeks, but very disappointed. It also made me break out around the hairline. I can't believe I bought a full sized bottle, this stuff is awful.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Amazing Shampoo and Conditioner Combo!
Review: I bought these, because I know the brand, but never tried the hair products... I am white, and have pretty normal hair, but since I started using this my hair looks amazing all the time, shiny and smooth!  I would highly recommend this product.  I also have dyed hair and I feel its safe!

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Scent is Amazing.
Review: I love this scent. I've been using 100% natural shampoo (morocco method) and was just tired of not having good smelling hair!It's not that cheap vanilla smell, it's a deep, rich but gentle scented vanilla (like the real thing.)It does foam up if you're used to the no foam shampoos.I wish the scent lasted longer than it does because if you use a different conditioner (even unscented) it will take out the scent.I didn't notice any improvement or harm done to my hairs health.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Oh no baby what is you doing? 😩😩😩
Review: Um is this really for natural kinky hair? My hair type is 4A this stuff made my hair feel like a brillo pad. 👎👎👎 luckily I bought the trial size.  I had to use a pint of coconut oil to fix the damage this shampoo did. I will stick with cantu natural hair line. :( one star for the smell though.  Probably will use it for bubble bath.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Amazing Product!
Review: This is easily my favorite shampoo! My hair type is 2B, and it's hard to find a product that gives me just the right amount of wave in my hair. I tend to keep it short so the waves are easy to manage, but I've decided to grow it out again, which means I have to get a good product. I used to use One 'n' Only Argan Oil Shampoo & Conditioner (which didn't give me the look I was going for but made my hair soft) until I discovered Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Shampoo & Conditioner. This stuff is great! It makes my hair soft and controls frizz in humid conditions. The waves in my hair do exactly what I want them to with this product. My hair looks nice and stays soft and shiny without a greasy appearance or feel. On top of that, it smells amazing!It's well worth the price, but why buy it on Amazon for $17 when you can get it at Target for $10?

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: ehh
Review: I have a lot of hair (thick, wavyish/straight, and voluminous). After using this after a couple months, i realized that my hair was thining and my hair became dry. i’m not sure why but i shed a lot of hair after using this. Was hoping this would work :/

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Never Again!
Review: First of all, I did not buy on Amazon. I bought at a store that specializes in beauty supplies so there is no chance that the product wasn't authentic. Lathered nice, love the scent but made my scalp ITCH so much. I used 2 separate times so there is no mistake.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Gives bounce to fine hair
Review: My hair is fine and wavy, and has been color-treated, so it's a bit dry. This shampoo moisturizes without weighing my hair down. In fact, my hair is curlier and has more volume when I use it but is still very soft. My scalp is also at the right balance.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: The scent reminded me of the Natural Instincts hair dyes- not bad, but not the best either
Review: This is an OK shampoo/conditioner. It did what it was supposed to do (cleaned my hair), but I don't think it did anything extraordinary. The scent reminded me of the Natural Instincts hair dyes- not bad, but not the best either.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Made me greasy
Review: I have fine, wavy, highlighted hair. This product made my hair so greasy. I was so embarrassed after straightening my hair that I had to take another shower to use another shampoo to get it out of my hair. Never again.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Worked GREAT For my dry, brittle, thick hair!
Review: This shampoo & matching conditioner has done wonders for my thick, dry, brittle hair and my dry itchy scalp.  I have tried many shampoo's and conditioners to no avail until I came across Carols daughter products.  The scent is great, it lathers well and my hair feels and LOOKS so much better.  My daughter has started using it on her color treated her and she loves it also.  Highly Recommend!

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Not a miracle product, and smells like your grandfather's aftershave!
Review: I bought the shampoo and conditioner at my local discount store that starts with a W.I paid $9 for the shampoo and $11 for the conditioner.These are not miracle products.I have naturally coarse and dry hair.  My hair is also chemically treated.These products do not help whatsoever with dryness or manageability.These products do have a strong vanilla/musk smell that is not pretty at all. It smells like your grandfather's aftershave.If you want smoother, softer hair, try Carol's Daughter Hair Milk.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Smells good, but my hair did the opposite of what it claims to do
Review: I wanted to like this.  It smells really nice. I have Caucasian hair that is very curly and unruly. I also have my colored every 8 weeks (dark brown). I like other sulfate free shampoos because they are easy on my hair color.  My hair is also dry because of flat ironing.  However... This shampoo made my hair very dull looking and didnt look shiny at all.  When my hair was styled it would take on a texture that I would liken to cotton candy.  I gave it a month or so and just did not like it.  Im giving it 2 stars because it makes a great handsoap.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Doesn't get the job done.
Review: Left my hair feeling dirty.  With other shampoos I can wash every other day, with this I have to wash daily and still doesn't leave my hair feeling clean.  For the price I expected better.  It doesn't lather well either.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Horribly dried my hair out
Review: I've used other Carols Daughter products before in the past with great results,  so I decided to try and use this shampoo to help put some moisture back into my hair.  After one way my hair wad so tangled and dry, I felt that the shampoo stripped what little bit of moisture out of my hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Great for sensitive scalps
Review: Carol's Daughter shampoos are probably the best-quality SLS-free hair products you can find for the price. As someone with a sensitive scalp and recurring eczema, this shampoo leaves my hair clean and my scalp feeling healthy. That being said, I haven't noticed any extra moisture or shine, or reduced hair fallout. It's not a miracle-worker, but it's a great shampoo.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: PRETTY GOOD OVERALL .. leftover smell is bit annoying
Review: Feels great, suds up well comparatively being a sulphate free product. I got a sample from Target store and used it this morning. Hair is feeling silky with the use of shampoo & conditioner. The only thing that's annoying is the leftover smell, though I love vanilla products, this one has a sort of annoying aroma once the hair dries up. You might want to consider Shea & Coconut-Hibiscus shampoo, another amazing, sulphate free product for hair, that suds up well and leaves you with silky hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Love

Review: The package arrived damaged and had only 1/4 bottled of shampoo I didn't even open the seal yet. I was excited to try the shampoo but the the way it looks I want to just garbage it. I don't have patience for posting photos, but I had to share this one, see my photo.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: I love this shampoo
Review: I love this shampoo! I bought it at Sallys when it was on sale. I've been using it about 3 weeks now and at first, thought my hair was thinning out or something. I was getting concerned. But, I realized its because my hair is so smooth and silky from this shampoo that my fingers run through it effortlessly! I use the leave in conditioner too which is okay, I don't really like the sticky residue it leaves in my hair though. I normally use argan oil and I don't even have to with this! Its shiny, smooth, silky and no tangles. Love it!

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Nice Product but Please Heed My Warning...
Review: You know how hair products warn you to keep out of eyes? You know how sometimes the product still gets in your eyes anyway and it stings a bit? Well, I'm here to tell you, KEEP THIS PRODUCT OUT OF YOUR EYES! This shampoo burns so bad that you will hate yourself and your life for like 10 minutes after you've finished using it. It will have you question every decision you've ever made in your life that led you to this point in your life where you're faced with having to make a quick decision on whether to try to wash the shampoo out with water or just punch the eye out of your socket. Otherwise, this shampoo is not very stripping, cleanses well, and smells very nice. Definitely works well with the corresponding condish.

Product: Carol's Daughter Black Vanilla Moisture and Shine Sulfate Free Shampoo For Dry Hair and Dull Hair, with Aloe and Rose, Paraben Free Shampoo, 12 fl oz (Packaging May Vary)
Title: Smells heavenly!
Review: I love this product! This is one of my favorite sulfate free shampoos. Let me start by saying this stuff smells AMAZING! The smell lasts all day in my experience. I'll be walking down the hall at work and get a waft of a light sweet vanilla, and it's wonderful. It does lather a little more than other sulfate free shampoos, but I don't mind it and I free it's much gentler on my hair than a sulfate based shampoo. I do like the "pump" on this bottle, as the shampoo is a little thinner than sulfate based shampoos. I also like that I see like little bits of what appear to be lavender flowers when I pump the shampoo into my hand. My only complaint is that I have a LOT of hair and I do feel that I have to use more this shampoo compared to others. My hair feels softer and less frizzy after I wash my hair with this. I also dye my hair and I do not feel that this shampoo fades my dye. Overall I think this is a great shampoo that you should add to shower caddy.

But if you're wanting Bluetooth headphones for a fraction of the price of Apple airbuds and don't really mind the music not being incredibly loud, I think they're a great buy
