Lightly fragranced, this shampoo lathers richly and rinses cleanly. It is moisturizing and leaves hair feeling healthy and soft. I would not use if hair is oily. Nor would I use it everyday. But it does ease dryness and make hair look and feel touchable.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Great lather, good value
Review: I was a little surprised when I tried to pump this stuff; it's really thick, and my hair is quite long so I figured I'd have to keep banging away at the pump for quite a while.  But when I applied it, the lather was so rich and luxurious that I realized a little goes a very long way.  And the result?  My hair looks and feels nice.  This is something I think I could use every day and not have my hair turn into straw.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Starts out sticky but...
Review: This curl creme gel works really well on my hair and gives my curls great definition. It’s a bit sticky which surprised me but works well. It doesn’t turn my hair stiff but actually made it softer.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Works Well, Strong Perfume
Review: This mask does a nice job, making my hair (thick and coarse) very shiny and manageable, however it does have a bit of a strong odor (I am very sensitive to odors, I should admit).  It rinses out well, but that lingering coconut perfume does linger a bit.  It's a good mask, though, and I'm going to continue to use it until it's gone.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I thought I was going to like this conditioner, because I tried the leave-in conditioner and loved it.  However, this one didn't work as well.  My hair didn't feel moisturized and it really didn't do anything for my curls.  I'll stick with my current washout conditioner and use the leave-in version to add extra moisture.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This thick, luxurious, moisturizing coco butter shampoo is wonderful! First, I needed only a small amount, much less than I usually must use, when I shampooed my very long hair. This shampoo suds up easily and cleans as it moisturizes. After I used it, my hair was ultra-soft and tangle free. This shampoo contains no sulfates, parabens or artificial colors. It does contain coconut oil, milk, murumuru and mango butters, which hydrate and nourish the hair. It has a light and refreshing coconut scent. In addition, this wonderful shampoo comes in any easy-to-use pump bottle for your convenience. It is fairly priced for an excellent, concentrated shampoo.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an unbiased review.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Perfect for mixed hair
Review: My kids have different types of mixed hair. This works for both. It isn't greasy and leaves the hair shiny and with no fly-aways. I would definitely recommend for daily styling.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Smells good
Review: This stuff smells pretty good but other than that I didnt really notice it doing anything for my hair. I have extremely dry and frizzy hair and this didnt do anything for that.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Nice Results
Review: My wife used this last night after an apple cider application, so she had a cap on for a long time.  She loved it!  Her hair today is shiny and healthy looking.  The cider is to fight dry scalp / flaking (black long hair) and the Coco mask helps repair all of the damage.  She loved it and will order more.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Natural type 4
Review: I was quite surprised that this product worked for me, my hair tends to not like anything. It was very moisturizing, it left my natural hair so soft and manageable. Not to mention the smell is great!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: A May Zing Conditoner!!!!
Review: I use hair masks 2 to 3 times a week on my super fried home dyed curly blonde hair and this conditioner alone made my hair softer and smoother than any of the masks!!! I cannot get enough of this product, I'm hooked for life!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Best. Thing. Ever.
Review: I think I’ve finally, FINALLY found something that works with my hair. I have 4b/4c (really more 4c) and it's always been a challenge keeping moisture. I read the reviews & decided to try. I absolutely love it ❤️ it kept my hair moisturized from the moment I put it on until even now overnight. It’s not too heavy, my hair drank it up & no residue was left. I’m going to stock up & cant wait to try on my daughters’ hair!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Not too fond of this curl shaping jelly. It made my hair feel dry & kinda hard. Made my curls very tight. The scent is cool but nothing that stands out.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is very creamy, and I wouldn’t use it with the shampoo as it left my hair heavy.  But as a special conditioner and treatment for dry heat. This is a terrific conditioner, and I love the delicate coco smell - not synthetic at all.  As I wash my hair every day, re sports, I use this once a week as a nice treatment, and it does the job beautifully.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo smells so good! I love the tropical scents!  It's also not "heavy" and doesn't weigh my hair down at all.  It doesn't have a high foaming lather, but it lathers just enough to clean the hair well.  My hair smelled good all day and I didn't look greasy at the roots by the end of the day.  Plus, sulfate free? Yes, please!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: A little pricey, but well worth it. Carols delivery again with this product, I have thick curly hair and after adding this to my routine, my hair has become a lot more manageable.  Curls look much tighter, hair is softer and has a nice shine, and it makes it much more easy to style! i love it, find something that works and stick to it!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Great for Wash and Gos
Review: This product is great for wash and gos. My hair was soft and not stiff. The smell of the product was light

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Left hair soft, full and manageable
Review: I used this shampoo without following up with a conditioner and then blow dried my hair. My hair came out super soft, full and manageable. I am very pleased with this product and look forward to continuing to use it. This shampoo becomes super economical when I realize that I can quit using conditioner if I use this product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Product is perfect for my daughter's curly hair. Product is wet and helps curl pattern form. Product also lays down fly away hairs.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Works Well In My 3C Hair
Review: I have been natural  for a few years now and I find using olive oil does not penetrate as much as I would like. Having a hair cream like this work so much better on my 3B-C hair.This hair cream smells good and does add moisture in to my hair. My only issue is I wish the container was a little bigger.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Excelente para cabello rizado
Review: Tiene un olor muy rico, deja el cabello rizo muy suave y define los rizos. Me encanta cada 2 semanas compro un pote. Recomendado al 100%

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Disappointed to say the least!
Review: I was so excited to try these products, and had such high expectations! Unfortunately they all let me down, and created extreme dryness/frizz/shedding. My hair was much more manageable and hydrated before I started to use these products. Now my hair sheds like crazy and I constantly have to add moisture. Note: My hair is naturally a fine and soft 4c hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Great for curly hair. Holds well. Smells amazinggg. It also feels like it makes my hair softer.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I used my usual shampoo (Nexxus) and followed it with this conditioner.PROS: It did make my hair feel soft.CONS: Though I didn’t dislike the fragrance, it’s not what I’d choose for my hair. It smells like a perfume and after a few hours I was beginning to develop a headache.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This adds no value to my hair routine besides making my hair wet and smell of coconut.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Love
Review: i am Happy my hair thank you .

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Effective but strong on fragrance
Review: This was great for fine, fly away hair. It really made it smooth and silky. It is a heavy product, so don't use on root unless the hair is really dry. Smells like coconut and it is a pretty strong smell.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Extremely popular at my house.
Review: I liked every thing about this - the smell, the feel, the detangling without greasiness, and even how  the pump delivered the right amount.  It was more expensive than the conditioner we usually buy,and went faster,  but with my frizz factory college girl gone away I'll buy more.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Very subtle coconut smell, but works wonders for curly fizzy hair. I have been using this the last week, and my curls are tighter and my hair doesn't frizz as easily, of course i combine with about 4 other hair products, but a great step to include when living with curly frizzy hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: This conditioner smells great! It also works really well and makes my ...
Review: This conditioner smells great! It also works really well and makes my long hair very soft without feeling like I didn't rinse out the conditioner from my hair. The bottle is kind of small, but it is good fro travel I suppose. I like that even for a small bottle, it has a pump.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This spray smells great, its lightweight and does the trick for my day old curls.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This mask smells awesome, like mango and coconut in suntan lotion. My hair is normally very dry but feels so soft and moisturized after using this mask. My hair is much more manageable and less frizzy. I've started using this weekly and it keeps my hair from drying out.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Quality
Review: This is a fabulous conditioner mask. My hair is curly and I can run my fingers through it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Can't Tell
Review: I've used a few CD products before, not much, but a few. I am looking to get to know the product better as it has been recommended to me by many people. I've used it twice on my granddaughter's hair and so far I cannot see any real difference from other shampoos that I have used. I do like the fact that it is sulfate free. My granddaughter's hair is extremely dry and this is supposed to help with dryness. I will use this in conjunction with other CD products in hopes to achieve the desired result.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I did not find this hair mask to be any more nourishing than standard conditioner. The dry ends of my hair weren’t helped much at all. It did not leave my hair overly greasy. But it also didn’t perform as well as I expect from a treatment mask.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Very thick
Review: It's very thick. Does not provide moveable moisture. Very tacky and sticky like glue. Won't be purchasing again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Perfect for new mexican high desert!
Review: Listen I love in the desert, I have 3C curls that go to 4C in places. So not only is it really dry but also I have to conserve water like crazy. This MELTS tangles and it smells so good, you will not believe how many compliments I get on my hair even on day 3. Like it's so moisturizing and makes me hair feel like the finest silk like babe get this just to try it

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Feel instant softness .. Great product
Review: My hair has been so soft after using this.. Wish I had sooner..

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This hair conditioner made my long hair softer and silkier.  The ends were dry before using this but it took only one application to really freshen up and moisturize my hair.  This is my first time to try Carols Daughter and I hope to soon try more.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Like others, I really like the whole Carol's Daughter line.  Makes my hair look, and feel great.  I love that its sulphate free, and as someone who is sensitive fragrance, I love how this conditioner smells.  Its a winner all the way around.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: For dry hair issues only!
Review: Definitely will moisturize your hair!  If you aren’t already skipping days in between shampoos, you will once you start using this shampoo.  Very light fragrance.  Lathers up nicely.  For someone who doesn’t have dry hair, I would not recommend.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: I was disappointed. Made my hair hard
Review: I made a mistake and bought 2 of these. I have to dilute it with leave in conditioner cuz it makes my hair hard. I’m not happy with it and it wasn’t cheap

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I am not picky about my shampoos. I do like coconut in my hair products, since I think both the scent and effect are good. This particular shampoo pumps out very little at a time, but it foams nicely, so that might actually be a feature.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a great product, especially if you have dry and/or color treated hair. My wife has both and absolutely swears by it.  I wouldn't recommend it if you have oily hair. My son tried it and his head almost looked like he used pomade. But for everyone else this is a top line, quality product. My wife and daughter give it five stars, I give it four and my son's opinion doesn't count.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This conditioner went on nicely and left my hair feeling soft and silky.  It does not have a lingering aroma.  I have hip-length blonde hair, very fine textured, and it does seem to have moisturized the ends, which can look very dry.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have been so happy with this brand as far as hair products go. This made my hair feel so soft and I didn't have to condition it for 2 washes. Did it make my hair feel stronger? No. I like the smell and the feel of my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Soft hair
Review: Hair is very soft after using this product  :)

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: this conditioner is moistening and has a nice scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Bought randomly, so happy I did ! Love it !!
Review: Wow ! I rarely write reviews but after getting out of the shower I fell in love with this set. I got it for cheap at Ulta and was like why not- best decision. If you like cocoa nut smells then you will LOVE this! Not much is needed to make it bubbly so a lil pump is enough ! Can’t wait to buy more !

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Good product!!
Review: I have a mixture of 4B/4C and I’ve just gone natural and by hair this is the only product that has truly moisturized my hair and clumped my curls. I love the scent as well and the texture is thick but very spreadable. I would recommend.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Sun, Sand, Salt
Review: Sun, sand, and salt makes my hair a mess in the summer as I enjoy my favorite activity - being at the beach.But once again Carol's Daughter shampoo comes to the rescue.This shampoo put life and bounce into my hair after a beach vacation after just a couple of shampoos.It lathers well and smells so good.A wonderful addition to the Carol's Daughter product line.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Item as described and fast shipping
Review: Item as described and fast shipping

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Amazing !
Review: My absolute favorite lotion! So good and applies so smoothly , you can’t even tell it’s there. I use this everyday and it’s perfect.

Title: FINALLY A PRODUCT THAT WORKS FOR 4C HAIR
Review: At first I thought this would be another hair fail. I have 4C hair, and there are so many products that promise to be compatible that aren't, all they do is dry you hair out, and sit on top of it making it gritty and harder to manage. I have low porosity hair, and most products just don't work for me. I typically use this cream first, then add about a tablespoon of the Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Scalp Oil and Hair Oil Deep Treatment with Castor Oil, 7 Oil Blend and Black Seed Oil, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Hair Oil for Natural Hair, massage it in, and my hair is soft, and clearly moisturized.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Not good for 4c hair!
Review: I purchased this product along with the curl enhancing moisture cream for my daughter who has 4c hair. It did not work for her hair at all see pics(last two) however for my hair it did great! I have 4a/4b hair. It defined my curls perfectly! The moisture was disappointing especially since this product is supposed to be for very dry hair; It was just ok. Overall I will not be purchasing it again for my daughter but MAY buy it for myself. If you have 4c hair save your money!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: I get so many compliments on my hair
Review: So far I am please with this conditioner and the shampoo.  I have tried so many different products since I've gone natural about 8 yrs ago. I do not have natural curls,  therefore I need to moisturized my hair to bring the curls out. I've consistently been using this and I'm please. I use a different brand after shampoo and conditioner called leave in or rinse out conditioner by Shea Martin.

Title: Spent 30 years looking for this
Review: I’ve literally been looking years for something like this for my very curly 3b/c frizz prone hair.  Most cremes are not strong enough to hold the curl and gels are too stiff and flaky and drying. This is perfect. I agree with other reviews that the scent is a bit strong and smells like mens cologne but I don’t hate it and it fades over time. I put it on damp hair in 4-5 sections and twist each section and then wrap around my finger and then shake my hair out. I usually wash my hair every other day and to reactivate I spray my hair down a bit and reapply some of the product. I understand that everyone’s hair is different and what may work for me may not for you but I’d definitely give this a try!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Coco Creme Curl Quenching Sulfate Free Shampoo for Very Dry Hair, with Coconut Oil and Mango Butter, Sulfate Free Shampoo for Curly Hair, 12 fl oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: Retread my frizzy hair!! This and the Monoi Carol’s Daughter masks are really good. Don’t get the almond one though. It’s thick, and it makes your hair silky! If you have frizzy hair, you’ll still need something for your ends when your hair is dry, like Schwarzkopf for Ends.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: I great product!
Review: I haven't open this order yet because I have some left over from what I been using already. I love Carol Daughter Conditioner and Shampoo. I had a problem with my hair matted up after Shampooing.  No matter what I used. I mean litterally matted up that my daughter had to help get it unmatted. I don't no why whether age or medication changed the texture of my hair. I had a hard time untangling it. I saw the advertisements on the HSN about the Carol Daughter. It said your hair will not be tangled so I decided to try it. I was like wow. I had no more problems with my hair. No tangles or anything.  It combs with ease. The only thing what I paid this time I feel was kind of steep.  When I first bought it which was off HSN I got 2 large bottles of the shampoo and conditioner together for a low price. I wish I would have went back and bought more when the price was a lot better

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Finally!!!!
Review: I have natural hair and scarring alopecia and have suffered from dry hair, scalp inflammation, balding, and breakage since 2006. I've tried so many different kinds of conditioners, including Jane Carter Solutions, Design Essentials, Meille Organics, Hairfinity, Miss Jessie, Naturall, Shea Moisture, and 3 Minute Miracle Moist. Some of these conditioners were ok, and some were better, but none completely wowed me until now. Oh my goodness, after using this conditioner, my hair had so much slip. It was detangled. And, there was so much moisture even with the driest parts of my hair. I was amazed by this Monoi Repairing conditioner. It took 14 years before I finally found a conditioner that would moisturize, detangle, and strengthen my hair. Thank you, Carol's Daughter!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: TOO SMELLY TOO EXPENSIVE for toxic products
Review: Opened it for the first time and wow the scent is wonderful....until it never. Went. Away!! TWO DAYS later, the scent is still so strong! It’s giving me a headache, I’m embarrassed to go out shopping because people act like I poured perfume all over my body, my husband is annoyed... it’s really bad. Look at the ingredients lists. The conditioner has PERFUME (aka toxic fragrance) as the 4th or 5th ingredient. This is not a safer or less toxic product but I thought if it worked I would look past that. Nope, definitely not worth it!Also, my hair does NOT break less and using both the shampoo and conditioner makes the ends of my hair staticky and the roots get oily. Not impressed and extremely disappointed considering how very VERY expensive this is!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: It says it helps with breakage after one use! Hair is falling out like crazy!
Review: I’ve been using this product for a month now. I always wait to write reviews. I hate reading reviews where people are already giving it 5 stars because they received it fast or the packaging is cute. I like real reviews. So the bottle says 92% less breakage after one use. That’s the whole reason I bought this. After a month, my hair is still falling out like crazy, maybe even more then usual honestly. Only good thing I can Say is my hair is shiny. But def. lot of hair fallout. Will not be purchasing again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Too pricey
Review: This conditioner works well with the shampoo, however after application of shampoo and conditioner hair was left straw-like feel. Once it was dry hair was soft. The conditioner also requires a lot to apply to hair.The price for this conditioner is not worth it. This conditioner can be used with other carol daughter products. The ingredients in this conditioner are similar to Sacred Tiare, which is no longer sold.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Too pricey
Review: Decent, but the price for the amount you get is not worth it in my opinion.  I have thin but long 3a curly hair and i went through this in a couple weeks and it worked only slightly better than other cheaper stuff i have used.  Maybe would be ok to use only a couple times a week to extend life but then may not have the same results.Scent is nice but nauseatingly strong on wet hair, luckily smell dulls down once it dries.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Are used carols daughter products before I was diagnosed and was very pleased with them
Review: I am a breast cancer survivor. Are used carols daughter products before I was diagnosed and was very pleased with them. I lost all of my hair during my chemo  treatments. As soon as my hair begin to come back I started using the products again. Today my hair is even healthier,  and grew back very very fast.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Healthier Hair with less breakage!!
Review: I LOVE Carol’s Daughter products, especially the Monoi line. The smell is amazing, it’s clean and fresh. My hair has always been thick but it’s healthier now. When I would shampoo my hair before, i would loose a huge ball of hair but since Monoi that doesn’t happen anymore.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz

Review: I feel like this made my hair weird. Most carols daughter products I only use once a week and with this shampoo and conditioner I had to wash more often and the conditioner did not work for my hair!

Title: LOVELY
Review: HG status❤️ My hair has never felt softer, stronger, smoother nor healthier after use. Beautiful sweet yet herbal scent! Very difficult to find cassia as an ingredient, THANK YOU.

Title: Wonderful Product

Title: Love!

Title: Natural Curly Hair Miracle! ❤💯🎉😘
Review: 1st 2 pics taken just now, up all day, As I cooked all day. Washed with Carol's line on 11.27.19. Still looking as I just washed it. 3rd pic whoa brave hair day! Carol's Daughters line. Is my product. 4 ever. Plus it's less than the product I won't name.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great stuff!
Review: I have thick, but fine, long hair.  This conditioner doesn't weigh it down, doesn't make it greasy after 2 days, leaves it super shiny and smells divine.  My daughter used it when we were traveling together and loved it so much I purchased her a set of shampoo & conditioner as well.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Wonderful
Review: What a wonderful product.  After about a day or two of use, I immediately noticed a difference in my hair.  Reduced itching, increased thickness, and a reduction in dandruff are huge starts in the right direction.  You don't need to use much for a good lather, either, with an 8.5oz bottle lasting a few months at least.  I've been very happy, and will continue using this product along with its shampoo counterpart.

Title: Soft and Bouncy
Review: I've tried so many conditioners from stores and online only to be disappointed in some way. It doesn't weigh your hair down like most deep conditioners, but leaves it soft and bouncy. I have very thick wavy hair that is dry from blow dryer and color treatment. I use it with other brands of shampoo. Try the conditioner and I don't think you will be disappointed.

Title: a product I have been loyal to has changed
Review: I've been using this product for years and I have loved it. However, my previous order has a different smell. I wondered if maybe the supplier had given me a fake product but I asked my mother who buys the same product from ULTA and she said hers smelled different too thus my assumption is that Carol's Daughter has changed the product. It doesn't smell bad.... but it doesn't smell luscious like it used to. The top of the bottle is also much harder to work with. I think they made the plastic parts inside the top flimsier. It still works the same as well, which is great because it tames my curly hair with out weighing it down. But I'm just so disappointed in the change of smell and how they tried to act as if it were the same product. If the smell has changed let me know ahead of time.

I have to unscrew and remove the whole top in order to get to the product which is not good because you have to use more then you intend to.  a 5 star at this time is not realistic because the jury is still out .  Other than that It is a good product

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: It works
Review: I use the entire system of products and my hair is in great condition. I have fine long blonde hair and I color or do the roots about every 3 mos. I was having a huge slow down in growth, as well, I was shedding big time. If my fine hair had a snag or tangle, forget it - a chunk of like 20 strands would come out. Haven't seen that since using monoi! Also, there is literally no hair on my comb after using now. I have been using this for 4 months. It's an easy to use system. Also, I discovered it from my mother in law who uses it, and she is black with straightened/permed hair so I'm pretty sure this works well for everyone, as the two of us have completely different hair types but we both love the CD Monoi products!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz

Title: This conditioner is superb!

When used together they made my hair feel better than ever before.  I immediatly came to Amazon and purchased both as the price was lowere here then at Sephora.  It is my new go to shampoo and conditioner.  My hair looks good for days when I use these.  I would highly recommend.  If you compare the different sellers of these products on Amazon you can find one that will save you quite a bit.  And when combined with Prime shipping it's really a great deal.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great, great Product, Poor packaging
Review: Best conditioner I have ever used. This works where many, many very pricey designer brands have not.  I am caucasian with thinning kinky, dry hair.  This conditioner really edges out the dryness without dulling or weighing it down.  Also good for managing fly-aways on dry hair.I am picky about products, give this one a B+ and will definitely continue to use it.  The packaging however, rates a D-.  There is just no excuse for the poor packaging.  The dispensing lids don't work well and the product is difficult to get out the container.  A first year student studying Packaging Science at RIT could do a better job of designing a user friendly dispensing system than the manufactures have done here.  The effectiveness of the conditioner makes it worth suffering through the packaging mechanics until they come up with a better system.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Lives up to promises
Review: I purchased the Monoi Repairing conditioner and shampoo and have used them together about five times now. I have long, thick hair which I wear in a severe bun for work on a daily basis. I'm very concerned about damaging or breaking my hair for this reason and consistently seek out shampoo/conditioner sets that promise anti-breakage or restorative effects. These products are easily some of the best I've used. Both the shampoo and conditioner are incredibly thick and feel very rich. They smell great, and my hair both feels very smooth and strong and looks great- even after taking my hair down from a braided bun the day after washing, I can't see any split ends. I usually don't use any shampoos that are supposed to be "hydrating" because my hair can get oily, but these products haven't weighed my hair down at all. I'm thrilled with the results I've seen so far.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great value for your money!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Hopes dashed..
Review: As with the shampoo, I was not impressed with this product. Lots of rave reviews claiming it helped with problems that I wanted to fix in my own hair made me think I had found a shampoo and conditioner I could stick with. WRONG. The shampoo was more disappointing than the conditioner, so my overall displeasure might be more the shampoo's fault than the conditioner's, but it wasn't without blame. I had to squeeze the s**t out of it to get enough to cover just the ends from nape to tip. My hair does reach my lower back, but I don't recall having to squeeze that much on any other conditioners. It's just too thick for the dinky hole in the bottle. (Same size as the shampoo hole.) It didn't leave my hair shiny, didn't help with breakage or fallout, and certainly didn't make it smoother and less tangled. In fact, after using both products, I felt that my hair had less luster than before I started using the duo. I have ordered a different duo from another brand which arrived today and I will be passing off the remnants of this one to the bf.

Title: Best product ever
Review: Best product ever, it does everything that it says it would do and more. I've been using this product now for about 6 weeks now and I have seen a tremendous difference in the texture of my hair being a black American with kinky hair. It actually has grew my hair, and it holds my colored hair longer than most other products which would have stripped all the coloring from my hair after the first usage. I read a lot of the reviews from other customers complaining about the price. That was my concern too at first but after trying it and seeing the results,  I don't  complain anymore, and you should take into consideration of the very smart way they designed the bottle tops. To let know that you only need a little. And who puts inexpensive contents and  non working,  no-good products in a glass bottle. I was a little skeptical with the name of it, I mean it didn't sound like a normal for a product, but I'm glad I didn't let that defer from trying it, keep up the good works. I will be buying more and referring it to my daughters and others.

Title: Best conditioner I've ever tried.
Review: Best conditioner I've ever tried.  Used Monoi Repairing Shampoo and Conditioner for approx. 2 months starting in Dec. 2013.  Once the Repairing shampoo had done its job, continued to use the Monoi Repairing Conditioner along with the Hair Milk co-wash.  The conditioner leaves my hair silky smooth and manageable.  I also use the Hair Milk leave in conditioner ( it can be used daily) and have achieved results I only used to get from my stylist.  I would recommend this product to those who are looking for soft manageable hair without be weighted down or greasy or slick feeling.  It is simply the best hair care line I have found to date.

Title: What's all the hype about
Review: This product was no different than the Dark and Lovely products I use, not worth the money. My hair has a lot more shine with Dark and Lovely products. One good thing is the smell.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Love this shampoo
Review: Love this shampoo. Luxurious, smells great, and keeps on thickening and moisturizing my hair over time while other shampoos lose their effect.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: my all time favorite conditioner

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Excellent products.
Review: Excellent products...I live in the Caribbean and have sun bleached hair that is also colored from time to time...these products make my hair feel great again!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great system for rebuilding and moisturizing dry, damaged hair.
Review: The Monoi hair care system by Carol's daughter is fantastic.  You literally see the difference after one use.  Don't let the cost put you of, the benefit to your hair is well worth it.  I say this as someone who has bought shampoos and conditioners in all price ranges, without the promised results until Monoi.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: favorite conditioner...
Review: I love this line of products from carol`s daughter, i'm happy i found it on amazon because this is the cheapest price and i use a lot of conditioner.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Improved overnight
Review: I love this conditioner.  It is true that it will improve your hair overnight.  It has made such an improvement on my baby's hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great Product
Review: Great conditioner, have to use a bit more that the suggested amount, but still a great value.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Four Stars
Review: Love it!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love it can't do without

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Three Stars
Review: smells fantastic, but only does a so-so job of conditioning

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great improvement in my hair.
Review: I love this product. It does what it states. It has stopped the breakage and my hair has started growing back, and it's a lot stronger and healthier. This will be the only product I use on my hair from now on.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Very good product,  I highly recommend it.
Review: A little expensive but worth every penny, it leaves your hair very soft and shiny.  I highly recommended it to everyone

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: No issues

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Carols Daughter Monoi is quality overall but no a favorite
Review: Enjoyed a sample so bought full size. Its ok, smells great/  My fine hair becomes more fly-away....I still  prefer Wen.however.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: I wouldn't purchase this again.
Review: I have oily hair and this shampoo did not strip my hair clean as some can. It also didn't feel as if my hair were fully clean. It weighed my hair down within 24 hours after use. I also use it in combination with the Monoi Repairing Conditioner and occasionally a thermal protectant product (which I have used for more than one year) when I use the flat iron. It does make my hair manageable for combing after washing and has a decent scent. It does not add much shine to my hair. I am in my 40's and color my hair every 2-3 months. I used this product at the end of summer and through to fall. It may have added some elasticity to my hair but it is difficult to tell at this point. Perhaps with additional use one could determine for certain. I will not be making a repeat purchase of this product. It may work better for someone with normal or dry hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: Im always happy to see this, and it works Wonders. Also delivered on time!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: needs a new bottle design
Review: I can't deal with the bottle.  Hard to open and close with wet hands.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Three Stars
Review: Very goog response

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Disappointed
Review: Not happy with this product for my hair type.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This conditioner smells great and moisturizes well. I wash & condition my somewhat dry hair once or twice once a week, and this conditioner makes it soft and handles frizz without making my hair greasy. It looks shiny and healthy, even though I'm long overdue for a cut. I can't speak to whether it actually makes my hair stronger, and normal hair loss (just normal human shedding, nothing remarkable) seems unchanged.It's relatively thick and creamy, and it goes farther than cheaper drugstore stuff--you get the coverage you expect from a nicer conditioner. 1-2 tablespoons fully saturates my long (bra strap-length), layered hair.The packaging, I don't like. The lid makes me crazy--you turn the lid a bit and it opens a hole in the lid--it looks like the old Vidal Sassoon lid, but with the action like a glue or yellow mustard bottle. For some reason, I have trouble with it every time. Finally, I just decided to leave it open all the time, which is fine for now (except that I worry about it getting knocked over, and it's on the spendy side vs. my default drugstore cheapness), but when it gets to the end of the bottle and I have to invert it, the battle with the lid will start over. Either that, or I have to waste the end of the bottle, which I resent generally, but particularly with nicer stuff (both because it's a treat and expensive).

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This conditioner is absolutely helpful at controlling split ends and frizziness.  The natural ingredients in it are very beneficial to that end.  The overall ingredient list is anything but "all natural" so if you are looking for an all natural solution, this is not it.Ingredients:Water (Aqua), Cetearyl Alcohol, Stearamidopropyl Dimethylamine, Glycerin, Isododecane, Fragrance (Parfum), Behentrimonium Methosulfate, Isohexadecane, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Gardenia Tahitensis Flower Extract, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter), Orbignya Oleifera Seed Oil, Moringa Pterygosperma Seed Oil, Phyllostachis Bambusoides Juice, Hydrogenated Coco-Glycerides, Hydrolyzed Silk, Hydrolyzed Hibiscus Esculentus Extract, Cassia Angustifolia Seed Polysaccharide, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Extract, Panthenol (Pro-vitamin B5), Cetrimonium Chloride, Cetrimonium Methosulfate, Cinnamidopropyltrimonium Chloride, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Octyldodecanol, Ceteareth-20, Quaternium-91, Citric Acid, Tetrasodium EDTA, Sorbic Acid, Chlorphenesin, Phenoxyethanol, and Methylisothiazolinone.The middle of the ingredient list is actually very beneficial and tends to "repair" hair damage such as split ends and dryness, without making hair greasy or oily looking or feeling.  You do not need to use a lot so go light at first until you determine the right amount to work into your hair.The scent i slight but pleasant. I would suggest this product for anyone looking for a good quality conditioner for dry or split hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I've been a fan of Carol's Daughter's products for several years now after getting some samples in from Sephora. My hair is fine, thinning (due to medical issues and medication), and will not hold a curl even if you were to spray it with superglue. To top it off, I get the frizzies like nobody's business. I've tried and returned or given away so many different brands and products over the years it's ridiculous.  Cue Carol's Daughter and their Monoi Repairing Conditioner. I LOVE this repairing conditioner. It makes my hair feel incredible - thick, full, soft, not weighed down at all, and the scent is soooo good. A lot of repairing conditioners or masks leave too much residue on my hair in order to keep the cuticle down and make the hair feel better. This weighs my hair down and leaves it feeling waxy or greasy. I don't want something that is going to make my hair look or feel like it hasn't been washed in three weeks. Yuck.A great way to use this Monoi Repairing Conditioner is to thoroughly slather this on your hair, put on a shower cap to keep all your hair up and covered, wrap one of those twisty turbans around your head to keep the heat in (or an old t-shirt), and go about your day. After several hours, usually before bed, take a shower and rinse the conditioner out of your hair. I do this every few weeks, and it has helped my hair so much. Even after having it bleached and dyed, my hair is still in amazing shape. No dryness, split ends, frizzies, or any other annoying hair troubles.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I’ve been using this conditioner along with the matched shampoo from Carol’s Daughter, and the combination is just right for my hair.  I have very soft, fine hair that is also very curly.  It needs a conditioner/detangler after shampooing, but it’s hard for me to find one that doesn’t weigh my hair down too much.  This combination strikes the right balance, leaving my hair clean, soft, and bouncy.I like the twist-cap bottle design with no cap or spout to break off or clog, but the label is very hard to read.  I try to set the bottles in the same order every time to help me determine which is shampoo and which is conditioner, as they look very similar and it’s almost impossible to squint out the print on the label.I’ve found I need only a small dab of shampoo and conditioner so, like many higher quality products, this one seems expensive only until you try it and realize how long it lasts.  I’ve heard many good things about the Carol’s Daughter line of products, but this has been my first chance to try them for myself.  I expect these to be my go-to shampoo and conditioner from now on.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: It took a couple of weeks of using Carol's Daughter Conditioner for me to admit that all conditioners are NOT the same and that I wasn't doing my hair any favors by stubbornly favoring a conditioner that is also used on horses!  From the first time I used my new conditioner I noticed that my hair had lost its bushy, somewhat straw-like quality, for the most part.  My wavy, short-ish hair now feels smooth and silkier.Several reviewers have mentioned the fragrance.  Generally, I like little or no fragrance in products, and this one has a fairly strong herbal (I think) fragrance in the bottle.  However, I don't notice any fragrance after I rinse the conditioner off my hair, and I haven't noticed any fragrance lingering on my pillowcase.  The dispensing bottle gave me fits the first time I tried to open it in the shower, but it only takes a slight twist to open the top to the dispensing position, so the problem quickly solved itself.Final verdict:  Very nice product.  I'm going to buy the shampoo also, after I finish up the last of my present shampoo (which is also used on horses).

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have never heard of Carol's Daughter products before, but I will be on the look-out in the future. I like this heavy repairing conditioner. I have one conditioner that I use religiously because it makes a huge difference in my hair compared to other conditioners. I like to try products though because you never know, one may really work.This product really works. It makes my hair feel really good and it adds thickness, body and shine. I can use it without my hair being flat or lifeless. This is a good conditioner. The only downsides are the cap on the bottle but it does prevent too much product from gushing out which is also kind of a good thing, and the smell. The smell isn't what I would call great. It's very different. It's not bad per se, but it's not wonderfully refreshing either. It's kind of like....what? But as for the performance of the product on my hair-it's fabulous and it makes me eager to try some other products of this brand.I don't know where aside from Amazon it is available because I have never heard of it. I do really like it and a little product goes a long way which is another plus. All in all, great conditioning effect just an odd smell, but it doesn't really stay on my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love this conditioner. It has worked well for my hair. I have medium length, fine curly hair. It can get incredibly frizzy if not given the right care. This conditioner goes on nice and thick, and conditions my hair wonderfully. It also rinses out without a fight. My hair feels healthier, in general, since using this conditioner.My only complaint is the bottle. Once I got to about halfway through the bottle, the lid explodes off  the bottle. I've tried putting it back on in every way possible. I've made sure the top was open, so the extra air could escape, but it still pops off. It's never enough to harm anyone(I don't think), but the lid will fly up into the air, with a little popping sound. At this point, I just set the top onto the bottle without fastening it on. I fear it will get dumped out like this, though. I don't know if this is a common issue, making it a design flaw, or if I just got a stubborn bottle.Other than the lid issue, I think this conditioner is wonderful!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Great Conditioner For Dry, Middle-Aged Hair
Review:
I have middle-aged dry hair, and was hoping this oil-filled conditioner might help.  It doesn’t have the same slippery feel that most conditioners give off when your hair is wet, and that had me a little worried at first.  It wasn’t until I blew dry my hair that I noticed how nice my hair felt.  I usually apply a mousse before drying to help with control, but since using this monoi conditioner, I no longer need to.I like it so much that I’m going to get the matching monoi repairing shampoo.  Its scent is very strong, and that might be a turn-off to some.  I love the fragrance and after my hair is dry, the scent isn’t noticeable.  This is the second Carol’s Daughter product I have used; both impress me.  The other I can’t live without, 

Carol's Daughter Mimosa Hair Honey Shine Pomade, 8 oz (Packaging May Vary)

  .  Just a little bit brings my hair back to life, provides lots of shine, and the jar lasts forever.Anyone with dry hair should give these two products a try—both help tremendously.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: I would read the 5 star reviews as a lot of reviewers seem to really like this product.
Review: I really did not like the cap.....took me a minute to figure it out.  Wet hands aren't a plus when trying to open a container.  I guess I could get used to it though.I don't know why this was not my favorite item by Carol's Daughter....it might be that darn top.  But I think this was made for oilier hair and/or much curlier hair than mine.  It seemed like it took the shine out of my hair as when my hair was dry, it was very dull.  Now, I think I should put here that I am a senior citizen and I have thinning, fine grey hair.  This just didn't seem my kind of conditioner.  I live in a retirement community and a lady that lives down the hall is African American and her daughter is an actress on Broadway.  She told me both she and her daughter love all of her products.  So, maybe it's just me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: makes my dry, color-treated hair soft and shiny
Review: I've been using this along with the shampoo from the same line for a week or two now.  I'm pretty happy with it.My hair is dry and somewhat damaged from color treatment.  I find this product very easy to work through my hair; it rinses out cleanly without leaving residue.  It smells very similar to the shampoo, and the smell lingers for awhile, so it's best to find out if you like this before using it!  (Try smelling it in a store before ordering.)My hair is shiny and soft when I use this.  I still get a bit of frizz, but I do think at least some of my frizz is tamed by using this conditioner.This seems to be safe for color-treated hair; I haven't seen any fading even though I shampoo and condition every day.  I think this also helps a little with detangling, which is nice, since my hair is quite long and gets tangled easily.  Definitely glad I got a chance to try this one!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Nice product but could use better packaging
Review: This conditioner leaves my hair moisturized and feeling soft. I have fine, fly away hair and I have to be careful about using conditioners that weigh it down and make it look flat. This doesn’t do that. And it has the nicest scent! The fragrance is floral and smells like jasmine. It doesn’t leave behind a lot of scent after my hair is dried, and that’s a good thing. I would probably grow tired of it if I had to smell it all day.The only thing I don’t like about this product is the packaging. The top twists to open a small hole in the top where conditioner is released. But it’s somewhat difficult to turn it all the way to open or close it, especially with wet hands in the shower. I would prefer a flip top like other conditioners. This one is just an annoyance.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5 stars is not nearly enough....
Review: note: since I use the shampoo and the conditioner together this review covers both as a "team" and I've left basically the same review for the shampoo.I don't give out five stars unless a product is pretty flawless; it has to meet or exceed its product claims, be fairly priced for what it claims to do, and have no obvious tweaks needed to make it better. This trifecta of excellence is rarer than you think but with this conditioner and its sister shampoo my hair has finally met its perfect match ....My hair: I am 42 years old, biracial with very curly, slightly kinky hair. It is fine textured, light to medium density, and breaks VERY, VERY easily. My hair is not chemically processed so I occasionally use a flat iron or curling iron for styling. Mostly I wear a medium length afro style these days with Jane Carter Solution Wrap and Roll, 8.5 Ounce as a styling aid to define the curls. Over the years I have used exclusive salon products like Ouidad, drug store brands, high end department store like Fekkai, earthy brands like Ojon, and just about everything in between. The results always left me searching for something that would help my hair feel and look healthy and strong. With all the trial and error I never found any one or two products that worked well enough to satisfy my needs. I can't comment as to how the conditioner works alone since I have used the shampoo as well from day one, but as far as my experience using both products I'd say that Carol's Daughter Monoi Repairing Shampoo and Conditioner produced results better than anything else I've ever tried.After the first shampoo and conditioner treatment I proceeded to comb through my hair while it was still wet, a task that usually involves a considerable amount of pulling and results in the inevitable huge hair ball that winds up tangled on the comb. With the Carol's Daughter Monoi products the amount of hairs on the comb was only about a quarter of what was usually shed with my former shampoo and conditioner. Suffice to say I was floored....."92% reduction in breakage" printed right there on the label is a pretty big claim to make and I was *very* skeptical of such a bold statement. I would have had no qualms about requesting refund if this product fell short of my expectations but this shampoo along with the conditioner delivers on its claims. With the first use I had about 75% less breakage than with my former products and the results have remained steady over six months of use. I waited to post this review because I wanted to see if I would need to switch products either due to the seasons changing or to see if buildup would happen or if the results would taper off; I've seen consistently EXCELLENT results over the months and for the first time ever as far as shampoos and conditioners goes I feel I have FINALLY found "the one"!The scent of both the shampoo and conditioner is fabulous; leaves a light scent on the hair.Does not leave weight or residue on my hair with either the shampoo or conditioner which is VERY important since my hair is fine.For what seems like forever my hair was constantly the same length due to breakage but in the months since switching to Carol's Daughter I've gained over an inch of length.My hair is soft and manageable.Expensive* but worth it and that's something I say very RARELY.*Edit 01/12: recently I've seen the price jump here to almost double what I've paid; if listed here for more than eighteen dollars you'll likely be able to "search" this for less.Easily, happily and 100% recommended!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: The bottle is really pretty and would be good for traveling
Review: I was especially interested in this conditioner because of the claim of 92 percent less breakage. My hair is prone to getting split ends and breakage. I had been using ion keratin treatment conditioner and saw some improvement with that, but I wanted to give this a try. The bottle is really pretty and would be good for traveling. The conditioner itself felt a little oily to me. It made my hair soft and there was no oily feeling once it was all rinsed out, but I did start getting split ends again after several uses and noticed my hair breaking again.  Sorry, but the ion keratin treatment was better for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Very little hair loss from day one, a huge difference for me.
Review: I use this conditioner with its accompanying shampoo.I have long hair, permed into coils. Until I started using this conditioner, I always had a wad of hair to clean out of my comb.From the first time I used this conditioner, there is virtually no hair in my comb when combed through it immediately after washing.There are still a lot of tangles to work through when my hair is wet however.In the evening when I comb through my hair, again, very few hairs to dispose of.How this works is a mystery to me, but my hair is softer and fuller after just a few uses.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: It smells heavenly.  I was shocked that someone said they didn't like the smell.My hair is on the dry side (thyroid disease) and I didn't notice that my hair was any softer than what my normal conditioner does.  Although I have just started using the Monoi leave-in repairing spray made by Carol's which I am loving at the moment.The lid on the conditioner broke but I really didn't like the lid anyway.  It's a twist lid that lowers up and down which reveals a hole to dispense the product.  Easy enough just to remove the lid and pour it into my hand but they really need to change the design.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: For an SLS free shampoo, this stuff gets CRAZY foamy. Like seriously crazy foamy.  I have tried a few other Carol's products, and this is my least favorite of them all. Yes it leaves my hair nice and clean and feeling great. Yes it is loaded with natural stuff and no chemicals.  Yes a little goes a long way.  But it loses a star for the smell. It smells like a urinal cake. I hate to say it, but it does. It reminds me of very strongly of the smell in every stadium, airport, and public restroom I have ever been. It is not awful, but not the best scent in the world.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: very perfumy  but nice conditioner
Review: This is a very nice conditioner that my curls loved.  It is however, VERY PERFUMY coming out of the bottle and you should not have a sensitive nose to use it. I did not notice my hair was overly perfumy when it dried so that made things a little better.  It also has an odd twist top that is sometimes difficult to maneuver in the shower.  I will use this as a once a week conditioner and will probably use it all.  I am not sure if I would reorder yet.  I will come back and update the review further into using it and see if my 4 star rating holds.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I use this with the 

Carol's Daughter Monoi Repairing Shampoo 8.5 FL OZ

  . This is the dynamic duo for my fine, thin, normal hair that needs volume and as much help as is possible with shedding and breaking. I got some fragile locks and this stuff has been the cat's meow on them!This is the best smelling conditioner I have ever used. There are a few that come close but none that can top it. It moisturizes very well without leaving my hair limp, lank, and lifeless. The curse of fine thin hair that's not uber dry is that many/most conditioners just weigh you down -- and by mid day your hair is a bunch of bah humbug'ness that makes you want to skip out on any form of mirror or reflection.You don't need a ton, it does distribute well in my hair, and it provides a medium amount of slip. I prefer "grabby" conditioners that don't make my hair feel like I waxed it up like a surf board. It's enough slip to comb through easily - and that's what I like.My hair feels soft, has volume, and (MOST importantly) I have found this combo (shampoo and conditioner) to really decrease the breakage and shedding I have. My hair is stronger and easier to manage.I do need to point out that I would not recommend this conditioner to someone with coarse very thick hair that requires a lot of slip in order to get out tangles and such. While I think this *could* work for that type I would be a bit scared at how much product you'd need. The cost of this stuff per month could be like an Iphone. My daughter has very very thick mixed hair that requires about 1/2 c. of conditioner just to be able to comb through. This is an 8.5 oz bottle -- you can do the math!For fine haired gals/guys this is a superb find. Curly or straight it works awesome. I do rotate it with 

Curl Junkie Beauticurls Strengthening Hair Conditioner, 12 fl. oz.

   because I find mixing it up a bit helps my hair to stay in top notch shape and between both of them my hair is loving me!I also just have to give a shout out to the ladies at the Carol's Daughters store in Pentagon City. They were fantastic, knowledgable, and immensely helpful to me (and patient!). Thanks girls!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: strong unpleasant smell
Review: I got this at Costco. Large bottles of shampoo and conditioner set for $30. I can't get past the smell. It's overbearing and lingers too long. I'm not a fan and will be returning it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have waist-length wavy-to-curly hair, and with hair this long breakage is an inevitable problem.  Anything that can help strengthen my hair is worth trying!  I was really pleased with Carol’s Daughter Monoi Conditioner (as used with the shampoo from the same product line).The conditioner has a light fragrance.  It didn’t really linger in my hair after I rinsed it out, which was really nice.  The conditioner isn’t so thick or greasy that it weighs the hair down, either.  It washes out very easily, but manages to leave enough moisture behind to make a difference in the hair’s texture.When I was combing my hair after the shower, I was pleased by how soft and silky my hair felt.  As it air-dried, I was pleased to see that my hair wasn’t frizzing nearly as much as usual.I’ve already added the conditioner and its matching shampoo to my shopping cart, to be purchased when my current supply runs out.  Carol’s Daughter Monoi Conditioner is definitely worth the price.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I was not familiar with monoi before using this conditioner, but I absolutely love it. I use this as an emergency backup conditioner in the shower, but where it really shines for me is that I put a squirt in a spray bottle with water and make my own leave-in conditioner spray. It works beautifully with my curls and it smells divine.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Reviewed by my wife: I really like the scent, but I found the dispenser cap on the bottle to be difficult to manage. My daughter's lightly waved hair looked dry and frizzy after using this. I had a similar experience with a different Carol's Daughter Conditioner - so I'm thinking maybe the formulation is not great for lightly naturally-curly Caucasian hair. Can't recommend it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I really love the way this conditioner made my hair feel after I washed but unfortunately it is REALLY perfumy.  The scent is really nice, but I have allergies to the perfume and won't be able to use it.  I gave it to my daughter to use and she LOVES it.  I really loved the way my hair felt, so I know it's a great product.  But not for those with allergy prone skin.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a really nice thick, moisturizing conditioner. It doesn't have too strong of a scent and it doesn't weigh down my fine hair. It washes out easily and also seems to moisturize my sometimes dry scalp. All in all, really like this conditioner though the cap isn't a favorite (would rather just remove it all the way to get out the product).

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: i cant believe the trickery!!!
Review: so this product actually has Sodium Laureth Sulfate, the same ingredient the shampoo boasts of not having. Sulfates create more lather and strips your hair of its natural moisture, leaving your hair dry and susceptible to breakage.i bought the conditioner because i co wash more than i shampoo and i couldn't believe one of the main ingredients was Sodium Laureth Sulfate!!!i thought this company was a hair improvement based company, not one that tries to trick its customers. The average person is going to buy the shampoo and conditioner, but what use are they if one the more harmful ingredients on hair is in the conditioner and then boast of it not being in the shampoo?very disappointing, i expected WAY better from Carols Daughters.....

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Conditions Hair
Review: I have 3c4a thick curly natural hair and this is my everything.  I loved it so much I would use it as my co wash but i had to stop due to the price.  It moisturizers and the smell it amazing. My hair is soft and defined every time I use this, I just love it so much. The only problem is getting it out of the bottle.  If only the gave more product for the price, my life would be set.The smell isnt bad, its not like anything I've ever smelt before.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Love the product not the buyer
Review: 40% off coupon does not work! Very misleading  you can get these cheaper

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: This has become my favorite conditioner. I now buy it by the liter
Review: This has become my favorite conditioner. I now buy it by the liter. It revitalized my curls, keeps them moisturized and smells amazing. I use the whole line now and have even gotten some family members hooked when I gave this brand out as Christmas presents.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Bamboo Water and Pro Vitamin B5 for Strength and Less Breakage, 8.5 fl oz
Title: Awesome product, shop around for price tho..
