Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: The shampoo smells very strongly of aloe but the odor does dissipate after your hair has dried. I have natural hair and the shampoo did not foam very much for me at all. I don’t usually have a sensitive head but this really irritated my scalp. There were small spots all over my head that felt like they were burning. It cleaned without feeling like it was stripping all my oils out, but the irritation it caused insured I won’t be using this again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: 02/Jan/20PROS+ I was a bit skeptical on how a water shampoo would work - but I was impressed. Application is very easy with the tip of the bottle, and you can really feel the 'freshness' going directly to your scalp. It foams very nicely and smells AMAZING!+ I really love the smell of this product!+ The foaming is great, it's not greasy or thick!+ Leaves a freshness feel after rinsing...CONS- None so far!Easy 5/5 recommendation.* I will update this review if something changes as I keep using the product.* If you found this review helpful, please click below! This will help other users like you to make informed decisions before spending their money!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I was very suspect of Carol's Daughter Aloe & Micellar Water Sulfate Free Shampoo | Love at First Wash Water To Foam Micellar Shampoo.  I thought there was no way this "shampoo" was going to clean my low porosity 4C hair, but yes it did!  First, it smells lovely.  It has a very clean, fresh smell to it.First, the bottle has a different spout than most shampoos and that is because the shampoo is so thin it's like water.  So, don't put it in your hand.  Put the spout to your scalp and dispense the product that way.  I learned the hard way and put the product in my hand and it just slipped through my fingers like water.  But even though it looks like water, the product foams up really well and it clarified as good as any clarifying shampoo that I've ever tried.  I used a scalp massager and  the shampoo rinsed out really well.  I followed up with a moisturizing shampoo (as I always do), deep conditioned, and my hair was very happy.  Even without any additional product as it air dried it felt pretty soft, so my hair was stripped of all the gunk it hold onto, but did not harshly strip my hair.  This will be my new clarifying shampoo!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Smells delicious and works charms
Review: I’ve never had such a runny shampoo, so I thought it was funny looking until I read “water to foam” ah!Next, I poured it on my hand only to have it all run through, until I read “apply directly with applicator tip to scalp” ah!Finally after figuring it out, because I suck at reading instructions, it was pretty awesome.The scent is fresh and delicious, it doesn’t foam much, but it’s due to all the good stuff on this and less of the bad chemicals.After using it a few times, I noticed my hair is much softer even I was surprised while running my fingers through it.I’m not sure if I’m still using the applicator correctly, but I feel like I’m wasting product.I would absolutely recommend this product, would recommend to the manufacturer a push pump that dispenses this product like foam, kind of like the hand dispensers. Would make it easier to apply.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is an interesting shampoo. The consistency is as thin as water but it actually does produce lather when worked into my hair. The lather is not as thick and abundant as a 'normal' shampoo, but it produces a decent amount considering that it has the consistency of water.The scent is also unique. It's botanical and a nice change from the usual shampoo scents. It is a bit strong, but the scent does not linger after use.It does not clean my hair as well as a regular shampoo. I can't quantify that other than to say my hair feels cleaner with other shampoos, where as with this it feels somewhat stringy.  The main reason for the low rating, however, is that it causes my scalp to itch. The itchiness stopped after I went back to a regular shampoo, and started up again when I resumed using this so I'm confident the cause is this shampoo. There's no flaking, but rather just an itch that persists throughout the day after using this.I'm not sure what in the shampoo is causing the itch (perhaps the scent?) but it's annoying enough that I won't be using this. An interesting concept for a shampoo, but one that just does not work for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 3C/4A SLIP for DAYS if you follow directions!!!
Review: I bought this product on a whim and I ended up really liking it. The directions say to pair it with a Carol's Daughter conditioner.  So I did!  The shampoo cleans very well (it removes ALL that GEL) but for my hair type I DO NEED a conditioner! So the HOOK for me was the Carol's daughter conditioner I paired it with. The combination of both is awesome! The shampoos preps the hair to receive the amazing hydration benefits of the conditioner. For me, the combination of this shampoo and the Carol's Daughter Almond Milk conditioner gives my 3C/4A high porosity hair the most slip I. HAVE. EVER. HAD.  I'm currently wearing mostly "wash n go's" and these products make EVEN my gel laden hair soft and malleable when I refresh it with water. Just the best.  I was so surprised. 💛💛💛

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: MOST AMAZING PRODUCT
Review: I had been searching for the right product that would help me reduce my washing days to once or twice a week. I have a very oily scalp plus dandruff so the thought of going more than two days without washing always freaked me out. I had done the acv/baking soda wash before and it worked well, but it's very time consuming and I was hoping to find something else before going that route again. I'm SO glad I tried Carols Daughter!!!!!!!! I love the tip to apply just to my scalp. I leave it in for about 5 minutes while I wash/shave then rinse, and then I use conditioner on just my ends. From the first time using, I've been able to go up to a full week without washing again. I thought for sure it would take some time to train my scalp but it was effective immediately. I'm so glad I also found it on Amazon so now I save a couple dollars and it comes to my door. I've gotten my daughter to use it as well, she has the same scalp/hair as me. I truly love this shampoo and next I'm going to try the rose scent. <3

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Not a fan
Review: I found this water-to-foam shampoo had a pleasant floral or garden type scent.  To apply, the instructions said to aim the open twist cap at scalp.  I find that a bit awkward because the viscosity, the shampoo begins to run down your head as you are placing the bottle down.  It does foam, but it's kind of awkwardly stiff, I found it hard to work through my hair.  It does seem to clean well, but not a product for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I like this sulfate free shampoo.  It is thin like a watery dish soap, and takes a minute to get used to.  The scent is very nice, floral.The bottle is clear and has a lift up style dispenser top.  This makes it easy to apply the soap to your scalp, instead of pouring it into your hands and then applying it to your scalp.It's a water to foam shampoo, and does just that.  Goes from water to foam.The result is clean, product free hair.  No residue.  Pretty easy to untangle.  I like it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: I liked it, a lot!
Review: I was never a fan of Carol’s Daughters products. The first one I ever tried was the Black Vanilla line and I think it was hands down the most horrifying thing I ever put in my hair, so I was hesitant to try this. I loved the idea of a liquid shampoo that goes straight to the roots and it’s been so long since I’ve found a decent detangling conditioner, I figured I had little to lose trying this duo. I LOVED them both, shampoo and conditioner. I used it on myself and my two children and loved the outcome for all three of us even though we all have different hair types. I have loose waves, my daughter has spiral curls and my son’s curls are so tight they more so zigzag than curl. (I know there are number letter combinations for this but I’m not familiar with them). While the shampoo had no major detangling powers, I found the tangles “melted away” with the conditioner.  I didn’t find the shampoo terribly stripping or drying at all but I think I feelings on this matter are relative. It depends on what you like your hair to feel like after shampooing. I like my hair squeaky clean and normally use a serious clarifying shampoo weekly to get that feeling, so by comparison I found the shampoo fairly gentle. However, I think if I were accustomed to a very gentle cleansing, I’d think the shampoo a little harsh. So It probably boils down to preference there. I’m not sure if I’d have loved the shampoo if I hadn’t also used the conditioner, but together...they’re dynamite! A few tips for the road:1.) The Rose water one is SUPER floral. If walking around smelling like a bucket of flowers would be bothersome for you or someone you know...get the other one!2.) The conditioner works wonders when you add water. I thought hmmm...nothing is  happening when I applied it, but I always detangle by further wetting my hair with the conditioner on and that’s when the magic happened (for all 3 of us).

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo was tried out by several family members. We all agreed that it cleaned well. One person said it didn’t suds quite enough but worked well anyway. The scent is pleasant and light. This is not a thick gel but a more liquid shampoo. The first time I used it I tried squeezing it into my hand but felt as if it was too liquid to use that way.  Now I wet my hair thoroughly and then just squeeze the shampoo over the top of my head, working the shampoo from the top to the bottom of my hair. I have used it several times and still like it very much.  I do not feel my hair is dried out.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Good for curly hair
Review: I have naturally wavy hair -- not ultra curly, just wavy.  I tried this shampoo because I liked the idea of putting less chemicals on my hair.  The first time I tried it, I wasn't too keen on it.  It didn't lather that well and it didn't make my hair feel clean.  I did notice, however, that it defined the waves in my hair more than my normal shampoo.  On the second try, I used a lot more of the shampoo -- literally squirted it all over my hair -- and it lathered well.  It also made my hair feel like it had been washed.  Again, I noticed it defined my waves more.  This is not my favorite shampoo but it's not a bad shampoo, especially for individuals with curly or wavy hair.  I've been using this shampoo when I know I will not be styling it with a straightener).

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Every washday worthy
Review: I couldn’t figure out if my hair wasn’t curling because of the products, or my method of styling. Apparently it was my shampoo and conditioner, whenever I use this shampoo and conditioner in my hair curls up beautiful no matter what products I use afterward. Start with a little on the shampoo and then gradually add more depending on how sudsy you like it. For the conditioner I did a finger in and emulsify between my hands, and then scrunch into the ends, while detangling from the ends up I can figure if I need more or not. Once I’m done detangling I take another finger of conditioner emulsify and rub it into the scalp. Love love love.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I am Caucasian with straight, fine hair that tangles easily. I have used this product three times now and I am not a fan. It is a liquid that foams up after you put it in your hair and massage it in. That part I like. What I don't like is how it makes my hair feel. It says that it detangles. However, my hair becomes more tangled when I use this product. I also had a hair cut one week ago which means that my hair is not as susceptible to tangles at the moment.It does say to use this product with the brands conditioner. I only use conditioner every few days because it weighs hair down. When I use this product, I HAVE to use conditioner in order to obtain any softness and to brush my tangled hair.It does leave my hair feeling somewhat clean, but not as clean as my typical shampoo. It feels weird and almost stripped after using. I don't like the feeling and I will probably throw out the rest of the product. It does not work for my hair. I do not recommend it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: BOMB AF
Review: This micelles shampoo has solved my shampoo dilemma. I’m super simple, my natural hair prefers a very simple routine. I’ve been an acv rinse girl for a minute, like years honestly and then I found like an occasional lather could be really good for me but I hate everything on the market and I found its bc of the coconut oil + shea butter in the doper natural products.I washed today with a black African soap and then stupidly put Shea butter on my edges and I was like ughh this shea butter is not what you need + how are we going to get it out. 30 minutes later I’m at CVS and 45 minutes later I find this shampoo.And it read so simply that I knew I had to try it. The salicylic acid really intrigued me. I assume it’s to act as a clarifying treatment for the scalp and the hair strands.I used it today. 2nd wash in a day and my hair is back to normal after stupidly using shea butter for the past week as a hair pomade.This product is GOLD. GENIUS. Very novel approach.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This comes in a bottle with a spout designed to dispense the product directly onto the scalp.  I have long/thick hair, so it took a little experimenting, to lift my hair and help the spout have access to my scalp, and make sure I was really getting the shampoo where I wanted it, but once I did that, I could feel it hitting my scalp, and when I went to massage it into my hair it soaped up enough I was confident it was there and doing its thing.This is a cleansing/clarifying shampoo... the Micellar Water is designed to lift away all impurities and gunk, I find that tends to mean I am more likely to need conditioner afterward.Because I was trying this shampoo for the first time, I did as I normally would, and my hair came out feeling nice... not many tangles, and generally, I was very happy.For me, this was an experiment that worked.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Stripped my hair and the conditioner sucks
Review: First of, when bought separately from conditioner it doesn't state that it is a clarifying shampoo. Had I known that I probably would've past on it. The scent is strong, borderline overwhelming and it made my hair feel stripped, my hair squeaked as I rinsed it out. I had to spend a longer amount of time rinsing it out of my hair to get rid of the stiff feeling the shampoo left behind and then followed up with a moisturizing shampoo. It didn't leave my hair feeling soft or moisturized.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: My Loc'd 4C Hair Loves This Stuff!😍
Review: Started my loc'd journey 7 months ago and am terrified of build up. I found this shampoo cause it's very light with no color or heavy smell so I figured that would translate into less product residue. I Looooooove this stuff!!!!! Its thin enough to slip into my locs pull away the dirt and then wash away in the shower! My locs are happy and juicy! I can never find the matching conditioner at the store so I haven't tried it yet. Since I just started my locs I didn't not use a conditioner for the first few months to prevent slipping and unraveling but my hair was perfectly healthy and moist using just this, and one of the hair oil blends from this brand as well. I would just wash my hair then oil it after, and spray with oil and water in the mornings!!! Definitely would recommend for my loc'd fam!!!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love that this shampoo is free from all of the gunk!!  My hair feels like hair is supposed to feel without all of the garbage that is usually in shampoo.This is very watery and makes you think it’s not going to clean your hair, but it does.You squirt it onto your scalp area and rub it in and it foams up great!The floral scent is very light.This particular gunk free shampoo doesn’t do anything great for my hair, like give it body, or make it super soft. I still had some tangles.Also, this being watery and having to use it how you do, will cause you to use this up fast.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I tested this shampoo without using any conditioner afterward, because I wanted to see how my hair would behave. I like how easy this is to apply. My hair retained its natural body and was very shiny once dry. It was also easy to comb through despite not using any conditioner. The fragrance is simple, pleasant and very neutral. If you like cucumber scented stuff, then you will probably like this, as it is very similar. This contains Aloe, and I think the aloe scent is probably the one that stands out the most to me. I also really love the bottle, I know this sounds weird but I think it would be great if re-purposed to be a portable bidet, other other useful squeeze bottle. My only real complaint is that I wish this had a lid that snapped on top of the applicator tip so that it was better for travel.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: I don't get it?
Review: I recently reviewed another "Carol & Daughter" shampoo, which I absolutely loved. I was looking forward to trying this one. Unfortunately I just don't get it. Granted I may not be the target audience? I have long fine hair. Maybe this would work better with short hair. This shampoo does pour out of the bottle like water, and it did not foam at ALL for me. I used a lot, and really tried, but it would not foam. I even put some in my hand and rubbed - still no lather. At first I found the scent off-putting, but when I realized that it was Aloe, I didn't mind it. I get that this shampoo is supposed to be easier to apply directly to your scalp, and I guess it is. It just didn't work for me at all. Luckily I had other shampoo in the shower stall, so I used that instesad.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I only wash my hair once or twice per week, and my scalp gets a build up of oil. I have a lot of hair, so it can be hard to get my scalp clean with regular shampoo, so this particular kind is very helpful. I didn't even need to wash my hair a second time. The scent was also nice, and combing through my hair afterwards was easy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Great lather, wonderful for thick, curly hair
Review: This is great stuff. Used it on my grandson who has extremely curly hair. While I didn't try combing it out totally afterwards, I could at least run my fingers through his hair some. It was really soft!  The biggest plus is the lathering action. I used too much, and will cut back next time, but the amount of lather was spectacular. The grand is half African American half Caucasian with crazy hair. Curly, curly and a bit of straight hair thrown in; a LOT of hair which has  only been trimmed since birth. The length when a curl is pulled straight is about eight inches.  Which makes for a bear to get regular shampoos to the roots without having to use a half of a bottle each time. Love this stuff and will be ordering the conditioner as well.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: BEST THING EVER!  MULTI-PURPOSE!!!!
Review: AMAZING FOR ALL!I tried this by chance and it was a GAME CHANGER!I am a white girl with thin hair.  I struggle with greasy hair and almost have to wash daily.  My sister is mixed (black and white) and I borrowed her shampoo because I ran out.  At first I thought it was weird, but I tried it and thought it smelled really nice.  My hair felt clean and nothing too crazy.Then, after a day or two I noticed I didn't get super oily greasy hair in day two of not washing.  This was amazing.  Because of this shampoo, I can go longer between washes, and weird bonus - I washed my face with it and my skin cleared up too. 😂Nevertheless, after years of searching for the perfect shampoo conditioner combo for my thin lifeless hair that gets stringy and greasy fast--this was a godsend.  Double plus it helps with my oily skin and I wash my face with it in a pinch.  I switched to this shampoo and conditioner and haven't looked back.  A little bit goes a very long way so it last long and is completely worth it for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Excellent shampoo
Review: This wash day delight shampoo is very nice.And goes on like water Hey guys it's rubbed into the hair and foams up.The makes for a nice lather and the hair.It's smells very nice it has a very invigorating aloe scent to it.Like it says on the bottle love at 1st wash. That's so true.It helps with building body and giving your hair nice full feeling to it. The shampoo is grated building volume to the here. Making it nice and fluffy and soft. It's an excellent shampoo that's 1 of my favorites that I use regularly. I love it thank you .

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Obsessed.
Review: I did not purchase this item on Amazon, but rather at another well known store. And let me say this product is amazing! I have long brown wavy hair and have been disappointed with all recent scalp scrubs/cleansers Ive purchased - since I cant even get them right on my scalp and instead they wind up just all over my hair. This product is hands down my favorite. The liquid product is prefect with the nozzle making sure it gets right on the scalp. It removed ALL build up on my scalp which I had been struggling with, and my scalp felt amazing all day long! It did feel slightly stripped after washing it out which I was not fond of; however I wont stop using this scalp cleanser and I will instead use it monthly as a great refresher. I cant say enough good things about it. Just focus the liquid on your scalp and when you rinse it off it will run down through your hair - no need to work it through your strands. Also use a decent conditioner after and you will be all set!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: The Aloe & Micellar sulfate-free shampoo lathers well without needing much in your hand. The first thought upon using this shampoo was it has the same pleasant smell of the Herbal Essence I used as a junior high kid in 1974. I love the smell and foaming properties. If you're looking for a strong-foaming, sulfate-free shampoo with a great smell (blast to my past), I can give this a strong recommendation.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: STRIPS YOUR HAIR!! BUT SMELLS AMAZING!
Review: So I bought this today at my local Target because I wanted something healthier for my type 3 hair then the Pantene repair and restore I've I've using for years now. I seen other curly girls use this saying it's perfect.  Honestly it smells great and the top is a plus! But it completely stripped my hair leaving it with a squeaky clean noise that wasn't great. It was do dry it was almost as if ny hair was matting together! I applied my shea moisture deep conditioner after as I also do after I shampoo and I don't think it helped any. I definitely rather the Pantene over this. I'm not sure how long it will take to go back to normal. I'll be returning this to Target tomorrow!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: You Need to Try THIS!
Review: This shampoo is unlike any other I've ever used and I have gone through dozens of bottles in the last few years (I'm kind of a shampoo junkie). From the applicator tip, to the water-like thickness of the formula that almost magically foams up once you start to work it in, to the amazing grassy-herbal scent, there is absolutely NOTHING I do not love about Carol's Daughter Wash Day Delight! My hair feels so clean and I love that it's not weighed down at all after I use it.  I wash my hair once or twice a week and I can honestly say on wash days I start thinking about this shampoo hours before I use it and can't keep my hands out of my hair for hours afterwards. I'm completely obsessed, telling all my friends and anyone who will listen to BUY. THIS. SHAMPOO!  I know I sound like a maniac.  Anyway, just keeping my fingers crossed for a conditioner in the same line.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I am a huge fan of Carol’s daughter shampoos as I have tried many of them. Like the ingredient list compared to many shampoos out there. However this one is not my favorite. They say you’re supposed to squirt it directly on your hair as it’s pretty much a water consistency however I find that very hard to control how much I’m using. I still end up squirting it into my hand first. Has very low suds to it. Seems to clean my hair however it does seem to leave my head/scalp and little itchy.  Leaves my hair fairly soft feeling. Overall does it work?… Yes. Is it my favorite… No.  I think I will stick with some of their other products instead.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo is water that foams after you apply it.  It doesn't make my hair fell slippery when I'm washing it, like shampoo does.  It makes it feel tacky.  I wasn't sure how that was going to work, but I gave it a try anyways.  I always use conditioner after I shampoo.  It rinses out easily, and actually does leave my hair feeling soft and not greasy.  I like the results, and I was surprised.  I thought my hair was going to be a mess after using this, but it wasn't.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: My holy grail
Review: This is a true clarifying shampoo. Not stripping, but not moisturizing either; that's how I like it, because I don't want any residues from my shampoo getting between my conditioner and my strands. The applicator bottle is my favorite feature and allows me to truly get down to my scalp through my dense head of hair.Use a little for a gentle clean, use a little more for a very rich lather. It doesn't have much of a scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This micellar water shampoo is nice. It smells okay, not my favorite but it's not bad. It also works well for not stripping my hair or making it feel dry. I have 3b/c natural hair and I'm big on getting products that are paraben, sulfate, and silicone free since they dry out my hair and make my curls fall flat and frizz. This works well for "wash day" shampoo. Not too harsh. Definitely not my favorite but it works well.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo is thin like water, but it does lather well and has a nice scent.  I personally did not care for it, as my hair didn't feel especially soft or anything.  I have very thin hair.However, my daughter loves it, she has thicker and longer hair, she said it made her feel like her hair was really clean and it invigorated her scalp.So I think this is one you will have to try for yourself.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a natural way to clean all of the buildup from a constant barrage of Products being put on your Hair. This is a naturally healthy way to strip all of the gunk off and leave your hairs clean and refreshed. I think it leaves a refreshing feeling while using it and would definitely refer you all to give it a try. Enjoy!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Genius Idea!!
Review: Having thick, natural 3c hair, I sometimes find it hard to get shampoo on my scalp. I usually have to dilute shampoo in a bottle with a nozzle to put it on my scalp. With this shampoo, because it is liquid and it comes in a bottle with a nozzle, I can easily put the shampoo on my scalp without having to cut the shampoo.  A little goes a long way. For this to be a sulfate-free shampoo, the lather is amazing. My scalp always feels clean, but not stripped, and my hair doesn't get all dried out.I hope this product doesn't get discontinued. I love it!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Pleasant scent and gentle cleansing
Review: I'm not too fussy with my shampoos--as long as it gets my hair clean without leaving it too dry and doesn't smell like a perfume store, I'm happy with it. But I actually really like this shampoo. The fragrance is light and very clean-smelling. The nozzle allows you to get right down into your scalp. I try not to wash the ends of my hair too much, so that is perfect. The price is reasonable, too!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: This shampoo turns liquid formula to foam lather
Review: This big bottle of shampoo feels very natural.  When the liquid formula is poured out of the bottle straight to the hair, it turns to foam lather and cleans hair.  Does not feel like stripping hair.  I have straight hair and use this shampoo occasionally for clarifying.  I recommend using same brand conditioner after shampooing for softer hair if using daily.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This clear shampoo has a nice, citrus-like scent, and cleaned my hair nicely.  The first shampoo didn't lather up much, but the repeat shampoo lathered up a lot more.  It takes a little more shampoo than I expected and i have short hair.  I like how the shampoo is squirted out of the bottle because it's a lot simpler than a pump and much less materials are used.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: never again !!!
Review: i am 41 years old, curly hair always trying new products, but for god’s sake i can tell in the most honest way that i haven’t tried any worst product than this !!! yes ! i know every person is different maybe for others works but for me is the worst! my hair was so dry than no conditioner made my hair soft it was so stiff that it took me 30 minutes to detangle and i had so much breakage that my hair is extremely freeze .... i can’t say with words how terrible experience i had with this product !!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Just ok
Review: Shampoo is just ok.  I’m not a huge fan of the watery consistency.  It smells really nice.  I have thick hair and I only wash once a week.  Seems to help a bit with tangles.  I don’t usually have a tangle problem though.I like that it’s sulfate free, which is great for my hair.  It’s overall just ok.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Matted my whole head. HARD PASS.
Review: This product stripped and matted my entire head. I have type 4 hair and finger detangling was a struggle. The matting was from the root to the tip of my hair. Awful. Awful. Product. If you want to keep your hair stay away from this stuff.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Don’t believe the commercial
Review: :( disappointed it dried my hair out to the point I refused to use it again. I had high hopes for this product and the conditioner smh they both suck. (Truly sad). :(

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: AMAZING
Review: This stuff smells amazing, and i just love how it's not a struggle to get this to lather up (4c hair rules)

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Favorite loc shampoo
Review: Love is for my locs. I’m getting back into working out and this definitely gives my local clean sensation and does it’s job. It leaves no residue at all. Afterwards I follow up with a hot oil treatment, but this is the truth.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Formula could be improved
Review: Absolutely love the way my hair feels after washing with this. But if you’ve got hard water it does take quite a while to create suds from this formulation of shampoo.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Unique shampoo product!
Review: This is such unique, new style of shampoo. It makes a great, easy lather. I will be curious to see how or if it preserves my color-treated hair. Pleasant scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: No good for natural/curly hair
Review: Avoid at all costs if you have grade 4 (a-c) hair type. It strips your hair of moisture, leaving it a tangled, course mess each and every time.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: The BEST Shampoo I have ever had!
Review: I didn’t buy it from Amazon but I got it at Target and I actually feel like my hair is actually being cleaned and not stripped and it doesn’t feel so dry!I love this shampoo so much I will keep buying this!I have very curly hair so this honestly works great for me!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Tangles Hair badly
Review: Created a huge rat's nest that cause breakage.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: AMAZING
Review: I bought at target actually but it works wonders. I use it when I’m not using my medicated shampoo and it’s making my hair feel so much better!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Great product
Review: Love the smell. My hair is so clean n soft.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Best shampoo ever
Review: LOVE FOR MY HAIR! Want to buy in bulk!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Leaves your scalp very clean but not dry.
Review: This is a great shampoo. The nozzle is brilliant. It deposits the product directly on your scalp so you actually clean your scalp and not just your hair. Also because of this you don’t over dry your hair because you can focus the shampoo more on your scalp and not on your hair shaft.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Great Cleanser!
Review: This is really a gentle cleansing shampoo. It breaks down the scalp & the dirt. Then I use another one her shampoo. The combo leaves the hair feeling & smelling clean. It is not astringent. I recommend.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: This shampoo is seriously the BEST!!!!
Review: I absolutely LOVE everything about this shampoo!! I got it because of Dr Dray ❤️Hair feels soft and looks shiny. It cleanses your hair very gently but yet effectively. I’ll definitely repurchase.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Works for me
Review: I am a white female with thin hair down past my shoulders. It gets greasy easily. I like to wash every 3 days. This makes my hair able to make it between washes. Third day I do have to use dry shampoo. I love the scent. I love the spout to get to my roots. My hair feels so clean using this product. The all natural ingredients is awesome. I bought my second bottle already.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Not very moisturizing as advertised
Review: The scent is on point, however it made my hair feel brittle and dried out. Not my favorite product, Sorry Carol’s daughter! Try again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Not worth it dries out hair
Review: I would say I usually love Carols products but this one not so much. My daughter is mixed and her hair is so curly. I usually love Carol’s products. I washed her hair with this and it dried out her hair completely. I did not like it and my daughter kept telling me her hair was hot and it hurt. Coming from a 2 year old. Must say I am extremely disappointed in this. Not worth it. Leaves hair super dry

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz
Title: Did not work for me
Review: I tried th8s pro

Product: Carol’s Daughter Wash Day Delight Love at First Wash Water To Foam Sulfate Free Shampoo with Aloe and Micellar Water, Paraben Free, Silicone Free, Micellar Shampoo for Kinky, Curly Hair, 16.9 fl oz

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Makes hair beautiful!
Review: I have very fine hair and my whole life has been me going back and forth from greasy weighed down hair to brittle dried out hair. I can’t believe how healthy this makes my hair look. I actually like my hair for the first time in my life. I haveAlways said my hair was just wavy enough to be annoying but not attractive. This makes my hair actually look wavy and beautiful. The smell is very organic and earthy but I like it. The conditioner has a little more of a flowery smell but it doesn’t linger on my hair. I noticed a difference in how my hair looked and felt with the first use. I can’t see ever using another product. I’m so happy with this shampoo.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Favorite so far
Review: I started using this brand a year ago and have tried almost every shampoo and conditioner. THIS is my favorite so far. The SCENT is amazing and it might be too much for some but it smells so sweet and my hair actually smells like something other than wet hair when I wash it. The scent even lingers after it's dry. Lathers very nicely and my hair felt so smooth and healthy. The bottles are also HUGE so this will last a while. I'm smitten with Carol's Daughter's.Update: I'm currently on my second bottle of the shampoo and conditioner, and have added the scalp oil and leave in conditioner to my routine. I do not understand the negative reviews about the smell of the shampoo and conditioner because I think they smell divine! My hair has been so health since I started using this and feels so soft after washing. And don't even get me started on the LATHER of the shampoo.The scalp oil and leave in conditioner do have a...odd and very strong smell. But they work extremely well for keeping my hair moisturized and OMG I've noticed my hair actually feels SOFT after using them and not greasy. After wasking my hair I apply the oil directly to my scalp and then scrunch in the leave in conditioner. I like the let my hair dry in boxer braids and when I take them out I have the most gorgeous, healthy, soft curls I've ever had.This hair care line is a. Life. Saver. I know every body and hair is different, so it might not work for everyone, but this is my holy grail.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Best thing I’ve tried…and I’ve tried LOTS!!
Review: My hair has been falling out & breaking for about 11 years. I’ve got Hashimoto’s Thyroid disease which typically makes your hair fall out. I’ve bought dozens of serums, vitamins and treatments. Nothing helps. My hair typically looks dry & thin & lifeless. While I’ve given up trying to “fix” my hair problems…Carol's Daughter products seemed like they might be nice.I bought this shampoo plus the conditioner.I’m very pleased with both. My thin fine hair feels healthier after just 2 uses. And my usually unobservant husband commented on my hair looking nice & shiny. A big plus - I usually need to use a nearly full palm worth of shampoo and conditioner - this stuff is concentrated. I only need a fraction of this compared to other brands.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Hair loss, dandruff & just not for me
Review: I have been experiencing crazy hair loss after using this shampoo & conditioner. Before, during and after showers. And it’s so much hair! I also never had issues with dandruff now have lots of white flakes with an itchy scalp. The scent is super strong but not unbearable. It does make my hair soft don’t but I don’t see any difference with the moisture. It’s helped me slightly with my curls but nothing extremely noticeable. Overall, not a good buy and not for my hair. Very disappointing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Review: The shampoo + conditioner clean hair as they should. But I have been using this set for a little over a month and I haven’t seen improvement of strength at all and it seems to have progressed my hair loss. It could be we were just not a good match, so I will be trying something else.✌🏽

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Scent makes you smell like a frequent tobacco smoker
Review: I wish I could love this product but it truly makes your hair smell like you are a pack a fat cigarette smoker. My husband immediately noticed along with a few people who hugged me and asked why I smelt like nicotine or if I had started smoking. You can tell the company tried really hard to mask the black castor oil “tobacco” scent with a really nice perfume scent but it just doesn’t work. The saddest part is that my hair really liked the formula! It was really soft and silky. Carols daughter please use a different castor oil without the tobacco scent! You’ll sell way more of these!
