Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This shampoo packaging is nice and classy and you get a decent amount of product for the price. The shampoo is thinner than I was expecting, but gives a nice lather, less is more. After using this on my hair for the first time, I felt that my hair was mildly softer than when I use my standard shampoo and it left my hair feeling clean and healthy with no premature grease before the next wash.The reason for the poor rating is the smell. I have used other products by Carol's Daughter in the past and have noticed that some of the products tend to have a strong smell, but usually I am a fan of the scents. That wasn't the case with this shampoo. I smelled this product direct from the bottle and while I could tell the scent was strong, I didn't realize how strong until I used it. The scent of this product is heavy and acrid. It smelled to me like chemicals mixed with burning oil. The scent was so strong that it actually gave me a headache, and I don't have strong scent sensitivity. With that said, scent is such a personal thing, many people may absolutely love the smell. The scent stayed on my hair for hours, even after using a citrus scented conditioner it was still strong. My whole bathroom smelled like this shampoo and I had to air the room out.Overall, I would recommend this product to those that adore strong smells and healthy hair. To anyone with a sensitivity to smells or to those that dislike their hair to smell long after a shower, avoid this one.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I was skeptical about this because of the smell of it. It’s not my favorite scent but it had a great lather, the next time I used it I didn’t use nearly as much shampoo and it was plenty so a little goes a long way. I love that it doesn’t have any harsh ingredients and for my dry damaged hair this shampoo did wonders! It smoothed out my hair, added much needed moisture and shine! I need to get the conditioner next!! Great all natural shampoo

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: When I first applied and started washing my hair it felt like a luxurious head massage. I just did not want this hair wash to be over.  It felt that good. It has a mild great fragrance. The scent of it is not overpowering. I have a product that I use now that I love and it really works very well for my hair. I was apprehensive about using a new product. Big Mistake… This product is the best.  I am a baby boomer and most of us are suffering from thinning, breaking and dry hair. We need a very moisturizing and strengthening product.  First, let me say this Shampoo is very moisturizing. Its ingredients include Castor oil, Black seed oil, and Ginger. It also has included Anti Breakage Hair Oil and Leave-In-Conditioner.  It is Sulfate and Paraben free. No Artificial Colors and it is Vegan.Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength system includes a conditioner, leave-in cream and a 7 oil blend hair and scalp oil. At this time I really have to take care of my hair very well because it will become dry, thin, and break. With the aging process, my hair grows slowly, thin out, breakage and very dry which I experience all of those.This product I will purchase the whole system to help strengthen my hair. This is a great product. I was hesitant at first but make sure you are not. I would purchase this again and again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really liked this shampoo! I think it would have been more effective if I had used it with the matching conditioner, but as far as reviewing it solely based as a stand alone shampoo, I was still pleased.Product comes in a squeeze out dispenser. The shanooonis actually thicker than I had anticipated and you only need a small amount to larger up. I dispensed what I would normally dispense with other shampoos and it was too much. So a little goes a long way. It left my hair feeling refreshed and clean. My hair didn’t feel particularly moisturized but also didn’t feel dried out after use. Using this with their conditioner would probably have left my hair feeling more moisturized. The smell was a little herby straight out of the bottle, but did not really linger when my hair was dried.This product is vegan and is free of sulfates, parabens and artificial colors. It uses natural ingredients like black cumin seeds, ginger and castor oil to nourish your hair. And I’m all about the benefits of natural ingredients which was a definite bonus for me. I also love the backstory that comes with this product. Created by a working mom reminding women that they are Goddesses. Love it.Would recommend and will likely purchase the conditioner because I like the shampoo so much.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: To say the shampoo market is over-saturated (pun intended) is an overstatement of epic proportions. This one, however, is an absolute winner.For a reference point: I have fairly thin hair, typical of a dude in his early 40s (thinning in the middle with some recession). My wife, big and awesome curly hair. We both LOVE this shampoo.Why? We both have scalp issues, and it didn't irritate. It smells friggin FANTASTIC. Awesome composition, as so little goes such a long way. It washes out easily. And both of us experienced advertised strengthening of hair. This is the probably the only shampoo we've both used with similar A+ ratings.My only criticism? Packaging. They'd be better served with a proper seal. The annoying 'Amazon liquid purchase leaking' was alive and well, needing a proper exterior rinsing. But a small criticism for a surprisingly amazon hair care product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo has a thick and creamy consistency when lathered so it takes a bit longer to wash it out all the way. For this reason, you don't need to use as much as you might think which will make the bottle last longer. I have not really noticed any of the advertised benefits but I suppose you would have to use it for a long time and also use the conditioner and oil to really reap any of the benefits. The one major drawback for me is the smell. The scent of this shampoo is horrendously awful. The best way I can describe it is to imagine a bunch of very fragrant herbs and leaves that have been been doused with cigarette smoke. Yuck.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I was very surprised at how much I liked this shampoo. It smells delicious and makes my hair feel so soft. I tend to have a lot of breakage in my hair and I noticed that when I washed with this shampoo I had less hair falling out in the shower. I switched over to another shampoo for a couple weeks and it wasn't so great for my hair. A couple washes with this shampoo and my hair was back to being smooth and soft. Very impressed with the quality and again, the smell is amazing. For the price it doesn't hurt to give it a try, I'm sure you'll love it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Smells is disgusting
Review: I cannot believe they let this shampoo go to stores smelling like this. It smells like a grandma who chain smokes all day long. 2 hours later, and my hair still reeks, even after using scented conditioner. My wavy hair does feel softer, but that’s bc it’s totally limp. And now it stinks, too. I only wash my hair like twice a week, but I don’t know if I can hold out that long. I bought this bc the store was out of my normal shampoo. I’ll never buy a bottle without opening it ever again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have no love for any particular brand of shampoo, and I’m always willing to try a different one that I usually use because it’s fun to try new ones; I might find one that is THE ONE. And, to be honest, I have many brands in my bathroom. I was glad to be offered this to give it a try. I color my hair frequently so it can get brittle at times. I tried this, and my hair immediately felt better. It felt softer, and it felt like maybe it wasn’t quite as brittle. However, the smell wasn’t great. Don’t get me wrong, it wasn’t terrible, but the smell wasn’t really a smell I liked. However, that’s more of a personal preference, and the shampoo seems to be working well. Recommend!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo has been great for me.  Leaves my hair feeling soft and nourished.  I'm very sensitive to fragrance smells, having tossed many a bottle on smell alone.  I find this Carol's Daughter formula to smell quite pleasant.  It's not natural in an essential oil sense, but the fragrance is very mild and pleasing.  The only knock is this shampoo is not cheap, once you look at it on a per ounce basis.  That said, I'm quite fond of it, one of my favorite shampoos of the year.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Was not wonderful for me to use
Review: I really hoped this would be a good product for my hair.Gave it a try and I just can't do it again.I have severe allergies and this one made my head hurt.The scent is simply too overwhelming for me.It did not leave my hair in a state that would make the headaches to keep using it worth it.So for me personally it is not the right one for my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have used this shampoo several times and it does a good job of cleaning my hair without stripping, and it has a most unusual but delightful scent.  The first shampoos didn't lather up a whole lot, but on the repeat I get a big lather.  It rinses out nicely but doesn't leave my hair with that "squeaky clean" feeling.  I like that it has some extra oils in it to help with damaged/dry hair.  My hair felt clean and soft after blow-drying and overall I think it's a good shampoo - just kind of pricey.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: lovely scent and lather
Review: While I couldn't identify the scent, I absolutely loved it. The lather was creamy and fabulous. I really enjoyed the process of shampooing my hair! I followed with my own conditioner for detangling (I have very long fine tangle-prone hair). It was easy to comb through my hair, which I air dried as usual. My hair really did look healthier than normal, very shiny and healthy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: The product is  Sulfate Free, Paraben Free, No Artificial Colors and vegan. The product is supposed to strengthen and moisturize weak hair, with castor oil, black cumin seed and ginger. The product has fortifying shampoo, fortifying conditioner, anti breakage, hair oil and leave in conditioner. The product is supposed to make your hair 15 times stronger in 1 use. Overall I like all the ingredients. The product has a strong decent, lingering smell. Overall I like it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo comes in a smaller packaging.  It is made with ingredients such as castor oil which will make hair feel soft to the touch.  Black seed is a strong antioxidant.  Scent is not too strong and for that reason, this shampoo can be used by both men and women.  Ginger makes scalp feel invigorated and leaves tingling effect.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength fortifying shampoo for weak, breakage-prone hair helps to strengthen and lengthen hair.This shampoo contains no sulfates, Parabens or artificial colors. It has castor oil, ginger and black cumin seed for a goddess strength recipe. After one use hair is instantly stronger, healthy looking and less prone to breakage.I highly recommend this product!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I've been using this shampoo for a couple of days, now. It says you'll get stronger hair from the first wash. I have to admit, I already notice a difference. My tired old hair feels softer and healthier and I'm already convinced that continued use will be more of a benefit. Recommended!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Probably one of the best shampoos I have tried for my thin and break prone hair. Not too pricey for its efficacy, leaves my hair smooth and silky and I have noticed less split ends and less hair left on my hands after I run my fingers through it. Scent is lovely and it is perfect for died hair as it contains no sulfates that might tamper with dye color.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have long hair that is color processed and dry at the ends. My hair gets tangled easily and often breaks off. This shampoo is amazing. It lathers up into a creamy thick foam. It has a strong ginger scent. This shampoo leaves my hair smoother, shinier, and easier to comb out. I’ve noticed less tangles and a reduction in hair breakage.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Now that I have tried the shampoo and am very pleased with it, I will need to try the conditioner.  This shampoo is paraben and sulfate free.  This is a nice thick shampoo, and it comes in an easy to open and use tube.  Unlike some reviewers, I have no issues with the scent.  The scent is mild.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Just a small dab of this shampoo produces a rich lather in my long, thick hair.  This makes it an amazing buy.  This one tube is seeming to last me forever.  It leaves my hair feeling clean, soft, smooth, and full.  It has a nice clean subtle scent.  It has quickly become my favorite.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Love product
Review: Love this product.  I started using the conditioner first and decided to try the shampoo and I was not disappointed.  I will definitely purchase again this is my new shampoo.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo made my hair so soft and easy to brush!! It's made in the USA and it's sulfate free so that's a bonus too. It's hard to describe the scent of the shampoo. It kind of reminded me of a tobacco scented candle my husband had - not a floral scent - and I really loved it!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Love this shampoo.The smell is amazing to me.Hair feels so soft after each wash.I have to get the conditioner to match.Also the bottle is a great size.I most definitely will be getting this shampoo more often.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Love this entire line of hair care stuff.
Review: I love this line of hair care products and this one is just as good as all the rest.  My curls are healthy and bouncy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Good except for the scent
Review: I'm not crazy about the scent, but it's very thick and feels concentrated. It lathers up a storm and I like the results. So, not a bad shampoo at all. If only they could change the scent

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Look at the shine 👐
Review: I absolutely love Carol daughters products I must have 🌺

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Here’s hoping for growth!
Review: It’s really sheer... not much moisture. Hopefully will help growth!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Hair loss and itchiness
Review: I have never seen so much hair loss… I didn’t think it was the shampoo/conditioner until I noticed it started a few days after I first used them. I bought this combination to strengthen my hair and it did the opposite!!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Mmmmmm..... smells yummy enough to eat!
Review: I did not purchase thru Amazon, but still had to say wow! This little shampoo bottle smells soo divine!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Shampoo is pretty good not my best but it will do
Review: This Shampoo is the best of all I’ve purchased from Carol’s daughter. It didn’t make my hair feel dry and brittle like Wash day delight, so I’d say yes it make my hair feel clean and somewhat moisturized.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: This shampoo has made a great improvement in my hair. Thicker and stronger.
Review: I love this shampoo. Thank you for making such a great product. I was having problems with thin hair and it kept falling out. I think I'm on my third purchase and it made a huge difference after my first one. I will continue to use it from now on. I use the conditioner as well.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Curly Hair NEEDS this!
Review: Once I found Carol's Daugher, I have never used any other product. Amazing!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Stops Breakage!
Review: Stopped the breakage I was experiencing, moisturized and softened my 4c strands

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: A products for all types of hair in need of moisture!
Review: Love this shampoo. I am non ethnic and use heat to straighten my hair. I use this every other shampoo to repair split ends and dryness.  It smells wonderful. My only issue…. when packing, please tape the lid closed . It must have been mashed during shipping and wasted some in carton😳

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Came unsealed.
Review: Ordered both shampoo and conditioner and came unsealed which is gross coz it makes me wonder if items have been tampered with. I may return these.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Best Product EVER for building strong Hair!!!
Review: My hair is very fine and breaks easily this product is amazing you have never felt my hair so strong and silky 😍

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: Love Goddess Strength
Review: Love how it smells and it makes my hair feel soft and conditioned on its own. I wash and go with the conditioner- don’t even rinse! My curls shine and smell amazing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: BUY THIS.. Transformed my hair!
Review: I have a million great things I could say about this product. I have fine/thin hair and had been struggling to find a shampoo and conditioner combo that worked for me. I’ve tried high end products, Olaplex etc for my damaged and dry hair. I was at my wits end and almost gave up. I found Carols Daughter products through Amazon and decided to give it a try.A LITTLE bit goes a long way with this shampoo (and conditioner) the shampoo lathers better than any that I have used. The shampoo/conditioner combo has left my hair feeling and looking better than it has in YEARS. Just the right amount of moisture (does not weigh down even my fine hair), the scent is very subtle (I’m not a fan of strong fragranced hair products) and the bottle lasts a long time.If you are struggling with finding your daily hair washing product, look no further. I recommend this again and again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Goddess Strength Fortifying Sulfate Free Shampoo with Castor Oil, Black Seed Oil and Ginger, for Weak, Breakage Prone Hair, Paraben Free, 11 fl oz
Title: All around amazing
Review: I daughter loves everything about this shampoo and conditioner. Her hair is so soft.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Don't Do It
Review: I bought the full set like a fool. Shampoo, conditioner and hair mask ruined my hair texture. Left my hair feeling dry, brittle and it made me shed more. A waste of money. I have come to loath this brand. They have alcohol in leave-in condotioner. Why the heck would you put alcohol in leave in conditioner? That dries out the hair. Ugh, don't use this company.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I wanted to love...
Review: I really wanted to love this product. I've used it for a few weeks now and my hair is worse, not better. It made my scalp super itchy and left my hair feeling like straw. I lost quite a bit of hair as well. More so then my previous shampoos. I've never had a problem with itchy scalp before. Really bummed. It also smells like sunscreen, which is ok if you want to smell like that. The only good thing is that it dried my hair out so well, I didn't have to wash it as often! I have fine/thin hair. I'm glad it works for most, but not for me :( Off to find another shampoo!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I love this shampoo. Makes my hair soft.
Review: I am so glad I found this shampoo at Costco.  I tried it and loved it at first shampoo.  Since Costco doesn't sell them anymore at the store, I bought it on Amazon.  It's costly here on Amazon. The price was better at Costco. This shampoo (and the conditioner) make my dry hair softer and healthier. So far, it's the best moisturizing shampoo and conditioner I have used for my hair type (my hair gets dry easily in the summer). It smells nice and feels good. Give it a try if you have dry hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Product is okay, no better than any other "Carol's Daughter" product
Review: I've use Carol Daughter's products for years.  For the price of this specific product line, I thought I was going to get something significantly better.  I must say that this product is no better than any other Carol's Daughter product.  Don't waste money on this one if you don't have to.  The other products work just as well and cost less.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: My hair is fine and thin
Review: My hair is fine and thin. Always has been. This shampoo is a delight. Leaves my hair looking fuller. I love it. A tiny bit goes a long way so it will last a long time. Believe me, I have, with high hopes, purchased many shampoos and wound up flushing them down the toilet in disgust. This one is a keeper.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Not my favorite carols daughter product
Review: I feel like this made my hair weird. Most carols daughter products I only use once a week and with this shampoo and conditioner I had to wash more often and the conditioner did not work for my hair! My hair is very long and not curly but wavy and frizzy  for texture comparison. I am thinking maybe curlier dryer hair might be more the type this is designed for.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great Shampoo and Conditioner
Review: I can't tell if I am reviewing for the shampoo or conditioner but I must say that conditioner is worth every dime of the twenty dollars. You don't need a whole lot of either (which is good because you don't get a whole lot). The conditioner goes farther than the shampoo and if I was in a bind to get one or the other I would honestly get the goddeses shampoo and use this conditioner to save a few bucks. Overall Carol's Daughter has amazing products and I love supporting them.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: A Win For Me
Review: I wasn't sure how my hair would respond to this brand, so at first, I bought a trial size kit. I fell in love with it after the first use!!!! I noticed it was so uch easier to detangle my hair. I brought it with me to a hair appointment.... my hairstylist said the same thing. She said my hair responds well to this brand........ that was in 2013. I've using this brand ever since.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great Product Line including the Shampoo
Review: I stopped using shampoo on my natural hair because it would dry it out so bad and I could barely comb my hair through even after extensive conditioning.  Over time that cycle left my hair damaged and I had to start cutting my growth until I started the Monoi line to include the shampoo.It's a really good shampoo.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: A little too squeaky clean
Review: This shampoo is just okay imo. Smells makes me think I'm in Hawaii but this is the kind of shampoo that when you apply to your hair may make it feel a little too clean/stripped. To the point that your hair feels squeaky when you're rinsing it out. Doesn't make my hair soft or feel very nourishing. I use it every week or two now to "deep clean" my hair but then use a more gentle shampoo on alternating days through the week.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Wonderful Shampoo!
Review: I have fine hair that gets ragged and frazzled at the drop of a hat. When I color it just gets worse. This calms down my cuticle and just makes my hair manageble. I will never use another shampoo again after using this one.Plus the smell is just devine.If you're on the fence about buying it, don't be. Its terrific.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Disappointed--there are better shampoos out there
Review: I initially bought this shampoo to see if it would help with my hair loss, since my friend recommended me to use sulfate-free shampoos. I used this for about month and saw no change in the amount of hair I lost. My hair felt thicker and stronger for the first week or so, but this effect eventually went away. I also felt that the shampoo was very drying and caused my hair to become more oily.Because this shampoo did nothing for my hair loss, I bought Aveda's Invati shampoo and Khiel's Amino Acid Shampoo and used all three shampoos interchangeably. For some reason, while the Invati and Amino Acid shampoos consistently reduced the amount of hair I lost in the shower every day, the Carol's Daughter shampoo made me lose much more hair every time I used it.So if you're looking for a gentle shampoo to help with hair loss, I would not go with this product! There are much better shampoos out there for a similar price.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Very good shampoo
Review: This shampoo is very good. It definitely moisturizes and strengthen your hair. It works well with the conditioner too.  Before I started using this, I was losing a lot of hair when I brushed it while it was wet. Now very little hair is in the brush or comb.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: ... purchased the Shampoo and Conditioner and I'am absolutely in love with the product
Review: I purchased the Shampoo and Conditioner and I'am absolutely in love with the product. Where has it been my whole life??If you have very dry hair (I have thyroid condition), this is the best product! I have been through a lot of products, tried top high end shampoos but nothing worked better than Carol's Daughter. Terrific!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Watch Out !
Review: Likes: Smell is not strong at all, bottles twist cap to dispense, after shampoo and conditioner hair is left softDislikes: a lot of shampoo is needed to get a good lather on textured hair, mid wash hair felt straw like and was tangled almost matted.Not worth the price !!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Leaves Hair Soft
Review: The light scent could be a problem for people very sensitive to smells. Cleans hair without stripping oils. hair is soft & moisturized.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Bought on a whim - will forever forward use
Review: Discovered it and thought I'd give it a try.  It made an immediate, positive change on my wavy hair.  Pricey, but worth it.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Carol's Daughter's products are wonderful
Review: Carol's Daughter Monoi Line, especially the leave-in conditioner saved my hair from doom due to using Wen Shampoo cleansers on my beautiful hair for only 2 weeks. This shampoo works great, but it does remove a lot of my semi-perma hair color. Maybe I need to go to Permanent color, or stock up on what I already use.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: GREAT shampoo with less than satisfying  lid.
Review: It is  a  really great shampoo.  Leaves hair soft,Shiney and manageable , but the lid doesn't  dispense well.  IT plugs and blows off.  The lid won't  screw back onto the bottle.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Not hydrating enough but smells good
Review: It was drying to my hair and could not be used without a conditioner.  The smell is fabulous just like the conditioner, but it needs either the wash out conditioner from Carol's Daughter or one of her excellent leave in conditioner.  Shampoo needs to be more hydrating though.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Love it!!
Review: Love this product!!! My hair has severely lessened in breakage since purchasing this product and I’ve only used it 3 times. I combined it with the conditioner and do a deep condition and it makes it ultra soft. Definitely will continue to buy this combination for my hair, I think I’ve found the right blend I can keep!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: This shampoo is awesome.
Review: I love the shampoo. I am a swimmer. It cleans my scalp and removes chlorine from my hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Not a fan...
Review: I read a lot of super positive reviews on this so perhaps my expectations were too high.. I have really long hair so it tangles easily and I get a lot of fallout. This product helped neither of these issues. I noticed that the shampoo didn't leave my hair feeling moisturized, but actually kind of straw-like. It also takes a bit more squeezing to get the product out than I'd prefer. It doesn't lather very well or spread nicely. I found myself having to squeeze more out just to get some on my neck's hairline. I have read reviews of other higher-end shampoos and conditioners that said they felt like the product received was a counterfeit version, so perhaps that is the case here. But for the actual product received, I wasn't impressed and won't be buying it again. Also, the smell wasn't quite awful, but it wasn't good either.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I'm a fan
Review: I was skeptical after my stylist recommended this brand - had never heard of it and it was a bit pricey at the salon.  (I have waist length, fine hair and am using the Monio Repairing Shampoo and Conditioner, as well as the Split End serum).Wasn't blown away after the first wash, although I did immediately enjoy the scent.  The shampoo actually does a great job of lathering despite the lack of sulfates.It was the third wash that did it.  I noticed my hair was shinier, softer to the touch, and got tangled less frequently.  (Pssst!  A dab will do ya with the serum; too much and your hair is weighed down - I have a lot of hair, and I use about a jelly bean size).I have since recommended it to my gal pals and will continue to do so.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: How does this have such good reviews?
Review: I am so confused by all the rave reviews. After using Color Oops in an attempt to remove hair color and being left with an extremely frizzy, damaged, broken head of hair, I searched frantically for the repairing conditioner/shampoo with the highest reviews on Amazon. This one is pretty pricey, but the reviews convinced me. Over the course of two months of using this, I've seen nothing but the deteoriation of my hair. It's left my hair extremely dry, brittle, and with more breakage than ever. My hair is currently a mess, but I've seen more repair on it within a week of using the It's A 10 Miracle Hair Mask than I have using this for two months. Not to mention it is ridiculously overpriced. And yes, I used it in pair with the shampoo.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Worth a try if you have problem hair
Review: I have fine, limp, fragile hair that is color treated. My scalp/roots are oily, while my ends are dry like straw. And I have a major problem with hair fall. This lathers better than any other sulfate free shampoo I have tried. I don't feel like it gets my scalp and roots 100% clean, but again, its an improvement over other sulfate free shampoos I have tried. I absolutely cannot skip a day without my roots becoming a greasy mess, but my ends seem softer and less straw-like with this shampoo. I don't know about the claims of reduction in hair fall. I can't say for sure I'm seeing less hair in my comb or shower drain. I really like the scent. The price is a little steep.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Good-hair-day in a bottle
Review: This is such a fantastic formula. Leaves my hair feeling sooo soft and velvety, and gives it a nice healthy shine. I always have a good hair day whenever I use this!

Title: Decent Shampoo

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: It works...I will use this 4ever
Review: I use the entire system of products and my hair is in great condition. I have fine long blonde hair and I color or do the roots about every 3 mos. I was having a huge slow down in growth, as well, I was shedding big time. If my fine hair had a snag or tangle, forget it - a chunk of like 20 strands would come out. Haven't seen that since using monoi! Also, there is literally no hair on my comb after using now. I have been using this for 4 months. It's an easy to use system. Also, I discovered it from my mother in law who uses it, and she is black with straightened/permed hair so I'm pretty sure this works well for everyone, as the two of us have completely different hair types but we both love the CD Monoi products!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Carol’s Daughter
Review: Love scent

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great for thick wavy hair
Review: I bought this mainly for my husband's thick, wavy red hair as the reviews sounded like it would be moisturizing and strengthening. Well he's been using it all week and his hair is forming thick, luscious curls instead of 'poofing' out like it usually would with our other Sulfate-free shampoos. I think this product smells great, too - pleasant and light, good for both of our use. Also, after reading the poor reviews about the cap and some user's difficulty in figuring out how to use it, I have to say it's actually pretty intuitive. Once you turn it counterclockwise (which is how you universally open things on planet earth), the center hole in the top opens and you simply squeeze the shampoo out. It's clean and easy - we love it. It's actually been pretty awesome for my superfine straight hair. The ends look moisturized and I don't have the little fly-a-ways I usually have to smooth down with leave-in conditioner. So far so good with this stuff!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Didn't repair
Review: I found the shampoo drying. My hair breaks constantly and I've tried many things including that monoi conditioning cream. Neither product worked for for me. I had hoped for more. Not everything works for everybody. I do like the cowash as a basic cleansers.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Will not purchase again
Review: AS said with the conditioner.......not any better and MUCH more expensive than a store brand.Disappointed! Because of amazons return policy of used items I cannot return!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Does not work
Review: This product smells great.  that's about it.  I have seen more breakage since using this shampoo then ever before.  Not worth the money

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love!!!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Best shampoo for hair
Review: Always use this product

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Love this product
Review: Love this product!  I have thin hair.  After using this shampoo for about 3 weeks my hairdresser asked me what I have done to my hair!  She said it feels thicker and in better condition.  I told her about Carol's Daughter shampoo and she said she wants to buy some!  Now every time I go the beauty shop she still comments on how much my hair has improved.  I see an improvement also, softer and feels thicker.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: great

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I love this shampoo
Review: I absolutely love love love this shampoo.  It gets my hair so clean.  It does not dry out my hair or leave a residue.  When used with the conditioner (sold separately) I get outstanding results.  These are my new favs!  The prices vary on Amazon, so compare the different sellers.  I would highly recommend!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great product
Review: I've been using the shampoo and conditioner for about two months now. I wasn't sure if I was having less breakage as other reviewers wrote, but then I realized that when I put my hot rollers in, I used to use 11 rollers, occasionally 12, but now 12 are just barely enough. I either have more hair or thicker hair. I get compliments on the shine, too. I'm about halfway through each bottle now and will probably treat myself and purchase it again when these bottles are empty.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Good product
Review: I have thick curly hair and this product does a good job cleaning my hair without totally drying it out.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Helps grow hair out long and strong
Review: Helps grow hair out long and strong. Be careful it can make the bath tub slippery when rinsing out!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Two Stars
Review: Dried out my hair

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Love this product
Review: I bought both the shampoo and conditioner! The shampoo is creamy and does not strip my hair.  It leaves it smelling great and hydrated.  It works best with the Monoi conditioner.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: One Star
Review: it didn't do anything for my hair. Save your money

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Four Stars
Review: Good product, use only when needed, but appears to help my hair when I need that extra conditioning

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great product!
Review: I will say the same for the shampoo as I stated for the conditioner. I love this product. It does what it states. It has stopped the breakage and my hair has started growing back, and it's a lot stronger and healthier. I would recommend this product for anyone who's having hair issues, or health issues. Sometimes health issues can be the major cause of hair loss.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: ... to die for and it makes your hair feel great. My hair has grown with Carol's Daughter products
Review: The smell is to die for and it makes your hair feel great. My hair has grown with Carol's Daughter products, too.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: This Product Does Not Live Up To The Claims.  Also, It Hurts / Burns Your Eyes.
Review: I don't write a review unless I'm blown away or very disappointed.  Well, you can guess where this is going.  I bought these products, shampoo, conditioner & hair mask (as recommended), because the claims, verbally and on the bottles, are that they reduce hair breakage / hair falling off your head by 92 or 96 percent (depending on which product you're looking at).  I used all three products. I saw a very, very minimal difference.  Simply put, the hair is still falling off my head, just a little bit slower.  I went from Very Excited when ordering, to Very Disappointed after using these products.Worst of all, your eyes may hurt / burn when you use this stuff.  And we know that's not good.  I don't know if it was 1, 2 or all 3 of these products that did that.  The way I figure it, if a product burns your eyes, it's not worth using.  I had a problem of frequent burning of the eyes when using this product.  If I have to be super, super careful to not get it in my eyes, then it's not worth the hassle because I'm discovering that hair fall-out is natural to some degree.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: carol's daughter
Review: The packaging came in good condition.I haven't used it yet, but it has an excellent reputation. I am looking forward to using it soon.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: good product
Review: Seems to be working on my granddaughters Afro-American hair. They have very curly hair, one  with very dry hair and this product is bringing life to her hair

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: ughhhh
Review: I bought this shampoo one time along with the set (conditioner and hair treatment) I fell in loveee with the smell but the these products left my hair feeling like straw, and super dried out. It was so awful i returned everything the very next day!!3years later I decided to give it another try, only the shampoo this time because I was sooo In loovee with the smell. I thought the shampoo wouldnt do any damage but boy was i wrong. My hair always feels super soft and shines to the max due to other products i use but this monoi shampoo had my hair feeling like i just bleached it. It was Awful!! No shine, super Dry, hard hair, straw, and I my hair began to shed all over my shirt! I hateeee Monoi products.The smell is very pleasing though.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Carols Daughter is fine but not my favorite, still prefer WEN
Review: Enjoyed a sample so bought full size.  Over softens and makes my fine hair more fly-away. Smells great.  Prefer WEN however....

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Smells awesome
Review: My hair was very dry and breaking, so I gave this shampoo a try since it was Sulfate-Free.  It is helping improve my hair strength and leaves it very shiny.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Carol's daughter monai shampoo
Review: I love the shampoo.  I think it probably works really good.  I have only used it twice.  Good shampoo and thanks.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: THE SCENT IS AMAZING

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Not for my hair
Review: I really hate to give this shampoo a bad review as I can see others had a good experience with it but it doesn't work for my hair.  I have long, fine, blond, color processed hair and this shampoo makes my scalp feel oily and my hair flat no matter how much I try to rinse it out.  The bottom of my hair does really well with it but I can't put it on my scalp.  I tried it over and over again hoping for different results but it disappoints every time.  I also feel like it leaves my hair really dangled and I have to use a strong spray in detangler to comb it out.  I hate to throw the bottle away so I will be using the shampoo on my ends only and something else on my scalp.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: always pleased

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: HATE IT
Review: First I will say is that the best thing about it is that it smells GREAT! But it makes my hair so hard and brittle, and I don't like that. I will not use it again - waste my money on this product!!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Sulfate-Free Shampoo, 8.5 fl oz 'Monoi' by Carol's Daughter
Review: A little goes a long way on my thick head of long curly Irish post menopause hair. Loved the coconut scent.  49 Ingredients:1. Disodium Laureth Sulfosuccinate,2. Sodium Lauroyl Sarcosinate,3. Sodium Lauryl Sulfoacetate,4. Cocamide MEA,5. Cocamidopropyl Hydroxysultaine,6. Acrylates Crosspolymer-4,7. Decyl Glucoside,8. Amodimethicone,9. Divinyldimethicone/Dimethicone Copolymer,10. Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: My all-time favorite! I have colored my hair and let it ...
Review: My all-time favorite! I have colored my hair and let it go natural, and either way, this shampoo leaves my hair shiny and silky andbeautiful! I just tried Wen products, but they made my scalp itchy and my hair feels coated.  With Carol's Daughter Monoi products, my hair is happy!I won't try anything else in the future, I'm sticking with Monoi. Also, my friend had told me thatthe skin products are the only thing she will use, and she has VERY sensitive skin, andshe is very picky!  I love the fragrance of these products, they remind me of a bubble bath I had as a child, and have alwaystried to find that fragrance, so this is a big plus!  I am going to go stock up now, I don't EVER want to be without Carol's Daughter Monoi products, shampoo, conditioner and hair mask!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have had the pleasure of trying quite a few of the Carol's Daughter shampoos and conditioners.  This one is not bad but to be honest not my favorite either. I felt like it left my hair clean and soft after I washed it however the softness did not last all day. By the end of the day my hair almost feels a little drier than before I started using the shampoo.  I'm sure using a conditioner would solve this problem however due to testing this product I have gone without conditioner for the past week just to see what the shampoo does on its own. ( Sidenote: most times I don't use conditioner anyhow. So still trying to compare apples to apples so to speak. )  Shampoo has a pleasant scent to it. Does not really lather very well as with most of their products I've noticed....but still leaves my hair feeling very clean afterwards.  As far as the packaging I'm not crazy about it. I just have to leave the lid open all the time. When your hands are wet it is very hard to open this twist top with no place to really grip without it slipping.  As with pretty much all their products I love that it is sulfate free!  You want to clean your hair not strip it.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Hair nightmare
Review: I wouldn't even give this product a one star if I didn't have to. I brought the whole set the shampoo, conditioner, the hair mask, and the leave in conditioner This is the worst product I have ever put in my hair. I'm in the middle of transitioning back to natural and my natural hair texture is 4a all of the products left my hair dry, tangled, and a matted mess. I have lost so much hair (literally two handfuls) getting all the knots and tangles out to the point of having a major set back with my hair. I am beyond upset. Do not believe the hype ladies I would never recommend this product line to anyone

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Nice Smelling Shampoo That Claims to Strengthen Brittle Hair
Review: Unlike other shampoos, this comes with a twist-off cap. It has a perfume-like fragrance but fortunately it's not that strong, and after you wash it out, the scent becomes mild, like any other shampoo. That said, the scent is pleasant and I wouldn't have minded it lasting longer. It lathers up very well and my hair felt softer and looked very clean after I used it.The label claims it's best for dry or color-treated hair and reputedly strengthens your strands so that less of it gets brittle and breaks off. I have thinning hair and my hair is so brittle sometimes as to shed a lot.  So this benefit is welcome, though after a few washes I haven't noticed a big difference in the durability of my hair; I'm still shedding.  Overall it seems to work as well as other shampoos I have but my main gripe is that I still shed and it doesn't add much volume.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: The scent is far too overwhelming for me!
Review: I like using many of the Carol's Daughters products. They tend to work well on my frizzy prone hair. The main issue I have with this shampoo is the overwhelming smell! It is not a gentle coconut infused scent at all. It almost felt like I had an allergic reaction, the smell was that strong. It's overpowering. I am very sensitive to smells and when I read the ingredients, I saw the perfume ingredients. Also, although it's sulfate-free, I always get a bit leery when I can't pronounce or recognize the ingredients in a product. And this is stocked with ingredients that I could not recognize.I will use Carol's Daughters products in the future, but not this one.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love this shampoo. I didn't even comb my hair after using this -- just blew it dry -- and it was straight and tangle-free. (I do have straight hair to begin with.) I didn't use conditioner, either -- just used this shampoo twice; rinsed twice.The scent is divine! It's flowery; perhaps a combination of gardenia and maybe frangipani? With a touch of coconut.I can easily go every other day using this, maybe every three days depending on how active I am. Hair still looks great.They've included Monoi Oil in this and I am wondering if it's Plumeria (frangipani), but it's an ancient recipe to strengthen hair. Mine is older and thinner (and dyed) and it's looking great.I will, no doubt, buy this product when I run out. Love this one!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Using both shampoo and conditioner, I have softer hair with very little hair loss.
Review: I use this shampoo along with its accompanying conditioner.My hair is permed into coils, and combing through it always produces a wad of hair for me to dispose of.Combing my hair while wet after using this product still requires some tugging, but there is little to no hair in the comb when I am finished.This has been true from the first time I used this shampoo and conditioner, and is quite a different story than is true with other shampoos I have used.I have always used a comb rather than a brush because I like my hair to feel completely tangle-free, so every hair gets the once over.When I comb my hair in the evening, once again: very few hairs get caught in my comb.On top of that, my hair has never been softer.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: My wife has long hair and found this very nice. She isn't a huge fan of the smell, but it isn't very strong. She says it leaves her hair soft and tangle-free. While she likes it, she's doesn't think we will buy more at the current price. She thinks the Pantene she normally uses does as good a job. The sulfate-free is nice, but now the Pantene truly natural is Sulfate free. It's nice to trust small companies that really care, but I don't know this company well enough to feel a connection. My wife does like it so we still give it 4 stars. If you don't mind the price, it does seem to be a good product.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: She has hair like mine but hers has been through chemo and is ...
Review: My mother bought this product for us and suggested that I try it out on my hair before she used it on hers. She has hair like mine but hers has been through chemo and is very susceptible to harsh products. My hair is thick and curly/kinky and somewhat course but it is also color treated and gets blow dried a lot to control it. I have used WEN which I like almost as much as my hair loves Pantene so I had a pretty good comparison to what this product would do. First off, I used the shampoo (1 application only) and it immediately stripped my hair of everything down to the cuticle and left it rough and dry. I found this shocking in a sulfate free shampoo so I assumed that maybe the conditioner would replace what was taken. It didn't. After waiting five minutes, it rinsed right out and left my hair roughened and abused and knotted. I did see barely any breakage so that much is true, right up to the point where I had to actually comb through the tangles this stuff left my hair with. Then the breakage tripled. I had to pump a significant amount of the leave in conditioner into my hair to work through the knots and even then my hair still felt rough and terrible. I managed to seal the cuticle during blow drying on the lowest setting but all that leave in conditioner made my hair feel gummy and all the shine was gone. I can't wait to wash my hair again just to get rid of the results. Would never recommend this product to anyone and informed my mother not to even try it fearing what it would do to her already fragile hair. This stuff is going back immediately.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Amazed by this product
Review: I recently purchased this shampoo in a set with conditioner and the repairing Monoi oil from another website.  I wasn't able to write a review there- but couldn't wait to tell people what a great product this is.  In the demonstration and on the bottle, it claims 92% less breakage after the very first use.  I really didn't beleive that.. figured they were exagerating to sell more shampoo- but decided to give it a try anyway.  In the last few weeks, I have literally had so much breakage that I feared my hair was falling out.  In the shower, my hand would swipe over the hair and come away with actual globs of hair.  I began worrying that I might have some sort of health issue.  I just used this shampoo/conditioner set for the first time- and I cannot believe the difference.  While it wasn't a zero-breakage situation, I was amazed to find only a few strands of hair in my hand.. FAR less than the clumps that had been happening.  The difference was dramatic- and I am thrilled beyond words.  I've spent way more money on "designer-y" products that haven't delivered the way this one does.  It smells lovely too- but with how well it worked, I almost wouln't have cared if it smelled terrible.. it would still be worth it.If you have breakage- I would say what do you have to lose?  Give it a try- it's excellent stuff!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 5 stars is not nearly enough....
Review:
I don't give out five stars unless a product is pretty flawless; it has to meet or exceed its product claims, be fairly priced for what it claims to do, and have no obvious tweaks needed to make it better. This trifecta of excellence is rarer than you think but with this shampoo and its sister conditioner my hair has finally met its perfect match ....My hair: I am 42 years old, biracial with very curly, slightly/kinky hair. It is fine textured, light to medium density, and breaks VERY, VERY easily. My hair is not chemically processed so I occasionally use a flat iron or curling iron for styling. Mostly I wear a medium length afro style these days with 

Jane Carter Solution Wrap and Roll, 8.5 Ounce

   as a styling aid to define the curls. Over the years I have used exclusive salon products like Ouidad, drug store brands, high end department store brands like Fekkai, earthy brands like Ojon, and just about everything in between. The results always left me searching for something that would help my hair feel and look healthy and strong. With all the trial and error I never found any one or two products that worked well enough to satisfy my needs. I can't comment as to how the shampoo works alone since I have used the conditioner as well from day one, but as far as my experience using both products I'd say that Carol's Daughter Monoi Repairing Shampoo and Conditioner produced results better than anything else I've ever tried.After the first shampoo and conditioner treatment I proceeded to comb through my hair while it was still wet, a task that usually involves a considerable amount of pulling and results in the inevitable huge hair ball that winds up tangled on the comb. With the Carol's Daughter Monoi products the amount of hairs on the comb was only about a quarter of what was usually shed with my former shampoo and conditioner. Suffice to say I was floored....."92% reduction in breakage" printed right there on the label is a pretty big claim to make and I was *very* skeptical of such a bold statement. I would have had no qualms about requesting refund if this product fell short of my expectations but this shampoo along with the conditioner delivers on its claims. With the first use I had about 75% less breakage than with my former products and the results have remained steady over six months of use. I waited to post this review because I wanted to see if I would need to switch products either due to the seasons changing or to see if buildup would happen or if the results would taper off; I've seen consistently EXCELLENT results over the months and for the first time ever as far as shampoos and conditioners goes I feel I have FINALLY found "the one"!The scent of both the shampoo and conditioner is fabulous; leaves a light scent on the hair.Does not leave weight or residue on my hair with either the shampoo or conditioner which is VERY important since my hair is fine.For what seems like forever my hair was constantly the same length due to breakage but in the months since switching to Carol's Daughter I've gained over an inch of length.My hair is soft and manageable.Expensive but worth it and that's something I say very RARELY.Easily, happily and 100% recommended!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Very good for my hair
Review: This shampoo smells amazing and it makes my hair feel wonderfully soft and it smooths down my sometimes frizzy long hair very well.  The lather is wonderful and my hair feels very clean after I use this.  I like this shampoo a lot.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Leaves my hair soft and manageable
Review: This shampoo has a gardenia fragrance, and even though it is sulfate-free, it lathers very well. I always worry that moisturizing shampoos and conditioners will leave my hair too oily or will weigh my fine textured, flyaway hair down. This didn’t do that. It left my hair soft and easy to manage. It seemed to have a little more bounce to it. I’m 68 and my hair is drier than it used to be, so this shampoo is helpful. And it smells really nice.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Easy rinse, softens even natural curls, would get again.
Review: This Carols Daughter shampoo comes with a twist cap, and is a low sudsy hair shampoo that rinses easily. I have natural curly hair and this does a great job of cleaning and softening without having to use a follow up conditioner. Has a pleasant almond like scent during shower but not after, no lingering scent. Reminds me of Baobab oil shampoo. I would get this again.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Caused shedding. Lots of shedding!!!
Review: I loved it to begin with until I realized that it is full of alcohol. Especially the leave-in. After a month of use my hair is coming out by the handfuls and there is nothing that I can do but wait and see how much damage this stuff has caused. I am so sad. Encourage to check out other reviews with similar experiences before you buy.  Warning ⚠️!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have waist-length wavy-to-curly hair, and with hair this long breakage is an inevitable problem.  Anything that can help strengthen my hair is worth trying!  I was really pleased with Carol’s Daughter Monoi Shampoo.The shampoo has a pleasant fragrance that seemed a bit strong when I first opened the bottle, but it was hardly noticeable after my shower.  It left my hair feeling clean, even though it doesn’t lather much.When I was combing my hair after the shower, I was pleased by how soft and silky my hair felt.  As it air-dried, I was pleased to see that my hair wasn’t frizzing nearly as much as usual.I’ve already added the shampoo and its matching conditioner to my shopping cart, to be purchased when my current supply runs out.  Carol’s Daughter Monoi Shampoo is the real deal!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great product!
Review: I am a senior citizen & like most my hair has thinned. This product, along with the conditioner has improved my hair texture & appearance beautifully.  This is the (white shampoo & cond.)

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have sensitive skin and this is too perfumy for me, however I gave it to my daughter who LOVES it.  It washes, lathers and cleans really great.  We have the conditioner as well which is very nourishing.  Overall, it's a really nice shampoo, but for my skin it is a no go.If you aren't sensitive prone, and love a nice clean, pretty scent, this is a must try!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I’m in love!
Review: I didn’t purchase this on Amazon (I got it at TJ Max) but omg I love love love it! Not only does it smell amazing, it has made my hair so soft and shiny. I have really fine hair and it’s over processed from coloring. This has completely transformed my hair. Honestly, it is comparable to Oribe for half the price.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Worst sulfate shampoo ever used
Review: I'm 100% black with thick and curly soft 3c/4a natural hair, and this shampoo is the worst sulfate- free shampoo I've ever used! The smell is amazing but it left my hair feeling so dry, brittle and stiff. It left a residue feeling after washing it out and although the bottle says detangling, I suggest no one ever think about detangling with this stuff. It would be impossible.  My hair was tangled and finger combing was out of the question. It lathers up and it is very stripping. But if you must try this, I would recommend using a little shampoo and A LOT and I mean A LOT of the monoi conditioner, to bring back everything the shampoo took away.I wouldn't recommend this shampoo to anyone.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: DO NOT BUY
Review: This stuff is SO DRYING to the hair. I do not recommend.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I give 3/5 stars because I love the idea of more gentle chemicles
Review: I’ve noticed a trend with shampoos that have less harmful chemicals. One this is my hair does not feel soft or manageable even with conditioner. Second, my hair is incredibly frizzy using these products.I give 3/5 stars because I love the idea of more gentle chemicles, however my hair just doesn’t respond well to it.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Reviewed by my wife: Love the scent; hate the dispenser cap. It seemed a little harsh on my daughters hair, and even with using the companion conditioner her hair was uncharacteristically frizzy after using this. I think our loose curly Caucasian hair is not really what they had in mind for this formulation.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Smells good but not good for my hair.
Review: I really love the smell and I wish it worked for me. The shampoo is thick and a little goes a long way...unfortunately the conditioner made my hair feel very dirty. It just doesn't clean very well. It's a shame because it smells so good (like coppertone to me). I do have fine hair so maybe just not good for fine straight hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Just like a pantene commercial!!!
Review: To start with, I am caucasian with colored,oily,long, wavy/curly hair and have been searching for a great shampoo and conditioner for 3 years.  I moved to Florida where the water is very hard and after a year of living there my hair was fried.  I couldn't figure out what was wrong until I went to my friend google and discovered it was the water.  I rented a water softener and have been searching ever since for a way to fix my damaged hair.  It was so bad, I couldn't brush it, wet or dry, full of conditioner, it was frizzy and nasty.  I wanted to chop it all off.  I've tried a lot of shampoo's and conditioners since then, and have been somewhat happy with the results.  I am also trying to get to the point where I wash my hair every other day, but it is quite oily and generally looks very dirty on the second day.  I have since moved again, and now lack a water softener and again have hard water.  I found Aphogee Keratin 2 minute reconstructor and have been using it once a week for several months with great results.  It gets rid of the heavy metals that collect in my hair.  But I still needed to repair the damaged hair, the Aphogee removes metals and prevents decline, but couldn't do enough to improve my hair.  Recently I bought the Monoi Repairing 3-peice starter kit which contains the Repairing Sulfate Free Shampoo, the Repairing Conditioner and the Repairing Hair Mask.  I used it for over a week, about 5 applications.  I loved the smell of it, I had noticeable bounce, but wasn't thrilled with the conditioner.  I have long curly hair, and I just couldn't get a brush through it after I used it.  I was afraid I was breaking more hair off with the brush and so I gave it all to my neighbor and moved on to my next shampoo/conditioner.  After a week of not using the Carol's Daughter however, I noticed a decline.  Hmm.  Maybe it was working, I just needed a different conditioner. Conditioners are my biggest problem, either it is slick and I can brush it, then it is heavy and weighed down or it rinses out completely and I'm stuck with a tangled mess.  So I bought the full bottle of the Repairing Sulfate Free Shampoo and the Rosemary Mint Clarifying Conditioner.  I've been using it for 2 weeks now.  The results are amazing!!!  I can easily go two days without washing my hair.  The Rosemary conditioner feels so good, it's kinda tingly and the smell is amazing!!  I still use the Aphogee and I use the mask (I kept that, didn't give it to my neighbor) once a week but a different day than the Aphogee.  My hair looks like those Pantene commercials, like one of those women who you don't think really exist.  My three  year old is petting my hair.  My hair dresser (got it colored last week) even commented how much softer it is.  My hair has never looked this good, never in my life.  I have wanted this hair, but never thought I could have these results, especially this quickly!!!  I can't wait to see how it is after 6 months of using these products.  I am thrilled with these products, and hope you have the same results!!!!Forgive me, but I plan to copy and paste this review onto the other Carol's Daughter products mentioned in this review :)

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: AMAZING!
Review: I have thick, course hair that is damaged/dry ends (due to ombre style). Most issues I have with "No-Sulfate" shampoos is that it doesn't get my thick hair clean (It can get very oily after a day or two). My hair feels clean and smells great.I usually alternate between Bumble and Bumble, Enjoy, and Bed Head. Those never quite got my hair frizz-free or rid of the fly-aways.I have to say this stuff is amazing, it sealed down all my "fly-away" hairs, and my hair feels very smooth and I see no frizz. My bangs are usually all over the place, but after using this they're clean, silky, and not all frizzy-fried looking!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Eh just OK
Review: I am almost finished with the shampoo and conditioner after almost 1 month of using it. I am in mid-40's, with fine hair which tends to get frizzy susceptible to humidity.  I long for long hair like when I was in my 30's.  I've even started taken a Biotin supplement along with this shampoo & conditioner line with hopes of seeing some improvement (especially after my hair stylists chopped off more length than I asked for about a month ago!  UGH but I guess she had a right to cut a lot off as my ends were tattered from breakage).  So, I thought I'd see what I could do about it by buying this line (and the supplements).  First, the packaging was disappointing and difficult to open, I was frustrated.  Second, I noticed the smell, its not bad or terrible, just not my favorite I noticed it had a bit of a coconut scent and I'm not into coconut scented anything it smells like a sunscreen a little bit, not the way I want my hair to smell.  Then, the first two times I used it I noticed a couple of hair strands came out right before I was about to style my hair.  I blew dried my hair (it has been a heat wave on the East Coast, high humidity, but my house is air conditioned) and I couldn't believe that my hair started to frizz underneath before I even walked out the door, another disappointment.  After continually using it and giving it a chance, I noticed less breakage (unlike the first couple of times I used it) but it isn't a good shampoo line for my easily humid prone hair, whereas there are other shampoos on the market that have done better in keeping the frizz at a minimum.  I wanted to like this shampoo but I don't think I'm giving it another chance.  Also, I noticed my hair wasn't as vibrant as I had thought it would be after using it.  I will go back to Kerastase (which is very expensive and I'm not sure I just spelled it correctly), or Aveeda products.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: this has a nice foamy lather. Gets your hair nice and clean I had that colored chalk in my hair took that out nicely. Smell is lightly tropical. I love how shiny and soft this makes my hair

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: good but not the usual Carol's Daughter quality
Review: This is good, but it's not a great as most Carol's Daughter products. It doesn't wash out of my daughter's hair easily and then we get suds when styling.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Love it!!
Review: I have never used Carol's Daughter before and I purchased this on a different site. Used this product first time today I have to say it made my hair soft and bouncy. I have thin, fine wavy curly hair. I use it with the Monoi Anti-Breakage Spray............love it. My hair just feels healthier. I have found my new shampoo and conditioner.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Love the smell

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: WORTHLESS PRODUCT
Review: I have been searching for an excellent sulfate-free shampoo and hydrating conditioner for my long blonde hair (highlighted), since my hairdresser got a little carried away using Schwarzkopf's BlondeMe bleach on my hair. What a nightmare! The BlondeMe bleach really destroys healthy hair quickly. I bought this Repairing shampoo and the accompanying conditioner from Carol's Daughter last week, and have used it twice. The first problem is the obnoxious smell (smells like Glade bathroom freshener in a fake Hibiscus scent). Not only can I not stand the smell, but people I work with have commented on the overpowering stink. The real "outcomes" from using this shampoo are specific to the manufacturer's claim that you will notice fuller hair and 98% less breakage after ONE USE. Not even close. Please do not waste your money on this product line (including the worthless Reparing conditioner). You'll also be doing everyone with a nose a favor too.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I love it.
Review: I used this product twice and I love it. I immediately notice the difference after the 1st uses.. My hair was soft,manageable and very little breakage. It smells good too. I recommend this product to anyone with over processed damaged hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: New formula?
Review: I used this and loved it until about a year ago. Just ordered this again and something has definitely changed. My hair falls out in handfuls now. It still smells great though. Note- I tried to post this review on their site and it apparently did not meet their standards. I wonder why they do not appreciate honest reviews.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Smells Great
