I became nervous, and used the moni hair mask followingthe shampoo rinse. The mask worked very well. Detangled nicely and no hair on the comb. Smells great. I love theshampoo so well that I use it as a body wash. Will be buying the shampoo again as a body wash.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Tumble weed
Review: I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone with color treated, fine hair. This shampoo made my hair dry instantly. It turned my long hair into a tumble weed. I had to use my hair mask to undo what this shampoo did.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Soft hair!
Review: I have thick, wavy, salt & pepper Caucasian hair. Due to aging, medications and hormone changes, my hair now is not the lucious hair of my youth.I've used Carol's Daughters' Monoi shampoo and Monoi Repairing Hair Mask for a year now. Since I am impatient, I use the mask without a plastic cap, for only about 10 minutes in the hot shower.Can't believe how easy comb-out is. Dried hair (air dry or blow dry) is silky, soft, shiny, and no frizz, even in high humidity. What more could you want? I'm not crazy for the scent, but it's grown on me. Can't tell if it's helped with breakage - that's ONE problem I don't have. Give it a try - maybe you'll like it as much as I do!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: A Very Good Moisturizing Shampoo
Review:
First off, the scent. It's excellent. The aroma is very light, kinda beachy sun screen like scent that I personally love. I Wish it came in a fabric softner.Secondly, what it does. Yes, it repairs the hell out of split ends and the condition of one's hair. Many of my ends were sealed and smooth. my curls were a bit more defined and soft.Third and Finally... the price. I cant complain here, really. Usually the decent shampoos are between 12-22 dollars so this didnt bother me at all. It works well with its counterpart 

Carol's Daughter Monoi Repairing Conditioner 8.4 oz

   but i havent gotten the chance to try the 

Carol's Daughter Monoi Repairing Hair Mask 7 oz

  , which I've received mixed reviews about.I am natural with 4a/4b hair which can be brittle and dry because of a past dye job. But this little gem does its job accordingly and I will be purchasing it again when I run out.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great!!
Review: Growing up I have always had oily hair.  I had to wash my hair daily so that it did not look dirty.  I have used everything from Paul Mitchell to grocery store brands.  Going through shampoo like crazy.  My sister started using sulfate free shampoo. She commented that her hair felt so clean.  I received a sample of Carol's Daughter Monoi during a beauty event for Macy's.  I love this.  It smells so good.  My hair stays clean and soft.  I now only wash my hair every 2 to 3 days.  It takes me a lot longer to go through shampoo now.  So I count this as a big savings.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I will keep looking for the perfect shampoo
Review: I am 49 years old and color treat my hair every 2-3 months; mostly low lights and very few highlights. I have oily hair but summer and color processing left my hair stiff and with a great deal of breakage. I purchased this shampoo and the Monoi Repairing Condition hoping to restore shine and improve the condition of my hair.After almost three months of use it has not improved the dullness of my hair and I continue to have breakage even after minimizing the use of my flat iron. It has helped a little with improving the elasticity of my hair. The only other product I have used on my hair after washing is a thermal protectant. I feel the shampoo and conditioner actually weigh my hair down too much. I feel the need to wash every day which only makes the scalp produce more oil.This product combination did not work well for me but may work better on normal/dry hair. I will use what is left but will not be purchasing replacement product. The scent is pleasant and it does a decent job of leaving wet hair manageable enough to comb out without too much pulling.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great product!
Review: Lots of lather, smells nice, cleans hair and washes out without leaving hair and scalp feeling dry, brittle and stripped of all it's natural oils.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Glad to be Natural
Review: Hair is very soft and manageable. I am always pleased with CD products. Keep up the good work. You only get 4 stars. Bring back the Ocean cleansing gel and you get 5 stars.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: Great product

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Love it!
Review: I would recommend this product to any body.  I love how it makes my  hair and my daughter hair feel and smeill

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Monoi
Review: Best shampoo I have ever used. Brought life back to my hair and it smells wonderful. Would recommend to every one.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: love it
Review: this product smells great and works great. I've used it for about a month now and I enjoy it. thanks.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Hair care product
Review: This particular shampoo is very good. It doesn't strip the hair or leave a film. Diffenently lived up to its potential less breakage was true.  Also leaves a wonderful fresh smell to the hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great for color treated/damage
Review: I used to use tigi rockaholic shampoo, but when they quit making it, I couldn't find another that i liked as well.  This one is even better.  A little pricey, but my hair looks the best it has in years.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great product
Review: Product was what we expected. Wife use it every day. I have started to sneak and use it on my hair as well. We would definitely recommend this product to others.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Excellent shampoo
Review: Use it with the conditioner and you will see remarkable results. I have extra long hair and the combination is remarkable.  No more piles of hair all over and I don't have the lingering hairs on my clothes and coats.  Great product.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: love it
Review: I am so obsessed with this shampoo, the smell is amazing, it makes my hair look amazing, I didn't need a haircut right away and when my hair looks flat, I wash it and it looks amazing, nourished and healthy

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Love this product.
Review: Have used this shampoo for three years and won't use anything else. Keeps my hair manageable and I have which hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love this product no has bleached hair and I highly recommend it

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Four Stars

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: It makes my hair look like it had a salon blowout without even trying
Review: Makes my hair look AMAZING! With nothing but this and the conditioner. Wouldn't have believed just a shampoo/conditioner could do this much to make my hair look good. It makes my hair look like it had a salon blowout without even trying

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Great stuff
Review: It makes my hair soft and easy to blow out, my hair is thin,curly and dry plus frizzy when the weather acts up. So far the frizz has not been to bad.  I do have to add that it works well with wen . I use the wen as a leave in before I blow out my hair.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: Got it for my ex, she loves it

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: The Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate Free Shampoo is an absolutely lovely scented shampoo.  The shampoo washes very effectively - almost too effectively actually - and leaves hair literally squeaky clean.  This is a shampoo you will need to use with a conditioner as it cleans so much that hair feels almost stripped of all oils and coatings.  I don't particularly like having my hair stripped that clean, but for those with very oily hair, this may be a good shampoo for you.  I have hair that ranges more between the dry/normal side, and because I have Asian hair, my hair is a bit more porous -  the shampoo just makes it too dry feeling after use.  After conditioning, hair feels much more smooth, soft, and will detangle easily - by itself, it will not.  In terms of scent, this shampoo is awesome.  The scent is subtle and slightly floral, and just smells pleasant overall.  This shampoo by itself isn't my favorite, but when used in conjunction with a good conditioner, it works fairly well.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: wonderful shampoo for color-treated hair
Review: This is more expensive than the shampoos I usually use, but I'd heard good things about it. Turns out, I really like it.The first thing I noticed was that the consistency is very nice. It was thick, but not too thick -- I could still spread it around and work it through my roots easily. Plus, it lathers wonderfully for something sulfate-free. So if you've wanted to use a sulfate-free shampoo but were worried about poor lathering, worry no more -- this could be just what you're looking for.I feel this does a good job of getting my hair clean. I love that it's free of a lot of harmful ingredients and that it's safe for color-treated hair. I've been using this for a couple of weeks now, and my color has not faded. My hair is actually quite shiny and soft, even though I shampoo every day.It's difficult to describe the scent, although I find it pleasant. There's a hint of coconut to it, a small hint of floral something or other, and a little bit of a powdery scent. It's a pretty strong scent, though, so if you can sniff some of this in a store before purchase, that might be a good idea -- because it stays with you, so it's best if you like it!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Generally good, a bit more monoi would be nice
Review: I found that this shampoo lathered quite well for a sulfate-free shampoo.  Sometimes you get no lather at all from sulfate-free shampoos, but this one gives foam.  I do find that you need to use a bit more than a shampoo with sulfates, which is pretty normal for when you go sulfate-free.  When you first squeeze this shampoo out and put it on your head it smells fairly strongly of soap.  I didn't really smell the monoi until I really got the shampoo lathered up.  I wish it smelled more strongly of monoi- the strong soap note remains.  In terms of efficacy- it cleaned by hair well, and left it soft.  Can't ask for more than that.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This says that you'll see results pretty quickly, and I have been using it with the conditioner. The Monoi shampoo has a nice, natural scent that doesn't seem to linger in my hair and lathers up well (not overly much), though I'm not a big fan of the cap (either screw off all the way or not, the pull up and dispense is a bit of a pain). I seem to have less breakage after a few uses (I've had bleaching on the end and I color, trying to use less heat on my hair as a result), but no noticeably less hair loss. Still my hair hasn't changed for the worse while using it, so I'll continue with the bottle to see if it split ends improve (lessen) and I'm happy with the fact that it's sulfate free.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Seems to do the job, but the squeaky clean texture worries me.
Review: This is a really nice shampoo in some ways, and not in others.  I have been wanting to try a sulfate-free shampoo for a while. This has a lovely beachy scent to it, so nice that I almost lathered a second time.  However, because my hair felt stripped and weak after the first rinse, I didn't do a second lathering.  After air-drying it feels clean, although not as thick as my hair usually does.  The individual strands feel fine and flyaway (and I've always considered myself to have thick, coarse hair).  Will probably save this bottle for emergency "hey, I'm all out of shampoo" situations, and continue using either my Sebastian or Oribe for everyday.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: This is the most amazing shampoo I have ever used and after trying it ...
Review: This is the most amazing shampoo I have ever used and after trying it I have switched to all Carol’s daughter products for my hair. I have thin curls, which tend to get frizzy. This line has restored vitality to my hair and you can feel it after just one use. It even smells incredible. I now use the Monoi leave in spray as a refresher for my second and third day hair. I even gave out this line to all the women on my fam for Christmas and they loved it, too. My sis in law, who is a hairdresser, said I always know all the good products.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo came well packaged. The scent of it was pleasant and kind of coconut-like. When I lathered this shampoo on my hair, I thought it was kind of thick in terms of texture. That's fine, but it just takes a little extra effort to lather it on in comparison to liquid shampoo. In terms of my hair after using this shampoo, it's still too early to tell but it does seem to have a good effect on my hair, which seems a bit fuller. Overall, seems like a nice shampoo.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Carol's Daughter Monoi Repairing Sulfate Free Shampoo
Review: This is a good shampoo!  It cleaned my hair and it felt moisturizing, fresh, and  soft while I was shampooing. It never did feel tight or dried out.  I was amazed that I had less breakage. I have relaxed hair and I had quite a bit or new growth when I shampooed, but it did not break as much as  it usually does when I wash it with other shampoos.  My hair is curly and it tangles easily but, my hair did not get that tangled when I used this shampoo.  The smell is nice, but I did have to use quite a bit of the shampoo. The bottle is kind of small.  I wish the shampoo came in a bigger bottle. I used the conditioner and it detangled my hair just fine.  My hair dried soft.  I did have some frizz, but I air dried my hair.  Overall this is a good shampoo to use!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: NO MORE BREAKAGE!
Review: I got the Monoi shampoo and conditioner as a free sample, when I placed an order for other Carols daughter products. I am 100% natural, no relaxer, no color. My hair is very dry, and thick. The shampoo made my hair tangle a lot. The conditioner did not make it feel as tangle free as I would have liked. I may try the mask or use the Paul Mitchell detangler with my next wash.My hair had extreme breakage before using this shampoo and conditioner. EXTREME breakage, when I would blow it out my hair would be all in the sink and bathroom floor. This product stopped my breakage in away you would have too see for yourself. I will use this product for the rest of my life, and tell all my family and friends about it. This was unreal. I cannot believe that this actually did STOP my extreme breakage. I am so happy and grateful this product exist. I have used high end Mazani, Alter Ego, Paul Mitchell... etc, and NOTHING can compare to this. If you have breakage this is for you!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Made my thin fine hair brittle and dry
Review: This was a terrible shampoo for my hair.I have thin, fine, virgin hair in good conditionThis shampoo made it feel like steel wool!Once and into the trashAnd i HATE waste.Bummed

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The shampoo is thick and creamy and it smells nice. I don't really have a problem with hair loss but I enjoyed using the shampoo. It made my hear feel soft.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: I really love Carols Daughter Monoi Sulfate free shampoo
Review: I really love Carols Daughter Monoi Sulfate free shampoo. It smells great and leaves my hair clean, shiny and looking amazing! I usually just wash my hair with Shikikai soap to promote growth and not use chemicals but every now and then I treat my hair to Carols Daughter Monoi shampoo. It smells great, works perfectly and the price for what you get really cannot be beat. I am just very impressed.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This shampoo lathers well and rinses quickly.  There is no noticeable aroma.  My hair felt soft after using it.  The best part, for me, is the lid:  Just twist it and a hole appears, so you can squeeze the shampoo out and if it falls over, it won't leak much.  Recommended.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Do not use!!!!
Review: The first time i used this shampoo it left my soft hair feeling rough, dry and like sandpaper. I used it again thinking I didn't use it right, but got the exact same results. I had gotten the 3 piece kit with this horrible sulfate free shampoo, the conditioner, and the hair masque. The conditioners were great, but I am so glad I got the sample sized shampoo because I'd be REALLY mad if I bought a big bottle of that crap.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Used this with the corresponding mask and strengthening oil. I liked using a sulfate free shampoo. It smells bad, but it got my hair clean. Even though I followed this with the mask and the oil, my hair is dry today.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This has a nice, pleasant mild scent. It cleans the hair well, conditions and repairs the hair. Other selling features - No sulfates, parabens, petroleum, mineral oil or artificial colors.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Terrific Item!!!
Review: I have been using items from Carol's Daughter for the past 2 years.My hair is (typical) Irish red, with a little gray, and this shampoo works wonders!It does a great job cleaning hair, removes all frizz, and prevents hair from getting cloggd in drains.It can be purchased on the Web, but not at this price and with free shipping. I urge you to give it a try. You will be very pleased.It's my very favourite and i highly recommend buying it from seller at Amazon.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Made my Scalp ITCH Like Crazy
Review: I purchased the CD Monoi Shampoo & Conditioner at the same time.  One or both immediately caused my scalp to itch to the point where I had to shampoo a few times with my previous shampoo to reduce the itching.  Also, my hair felt very dry afterward, and my comb didn't go through my hair smoothly after conditioning.  'Back to WEN I go.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is my favorite shampoo of all time. The scent is devine -- and I mean OMG this shampoo smells soooo good! BUT scent is just not enough for the discerning consumer nowadays -- I needed it to WORK. It completely delivered.My hair was clean and not stripped -- not tangly, straggly, or crunchy after the shampooing. I never use it on its own since I always use conditioner so I haven't tried it by itself-- but as part of the duo its fabulous!The first time I used it I shed more hair. That got me a little worried. I tried it again and have been using it for a while now and, after that initial shed, I have notice a dramatic decrease in my shedding! My hair is baby fine, very thin, and just below chin length. Overall my hair is normal with a tendency to an oily scalp. This shampoo does a phenomenal job on my hair! It has a very good amount of lather for a sulfate free shampoo (many of them do not lather at all), is easy to spread through my hair, and does not require scrubbing as if I'm cleaning my pots and pans to get my scalp clean.I do have a few caveats for you: If your hair is very thick (my daughter) you will use a fair bit of this stuff to shampoo. Also if your hair is prone to tangling like crazy (my daughter again) this did not help that -- it didn't make it worse but it didn't make it better. I think this shampoo is best for fine hair that is thin to medium (not overly thick) that tends to be normal or perhaps normal to oily. My daughter (in addition to the above) has exceptionally dry hair and this is not a shampoo we'd use on her on a regular basis. She doesn't have breakage or shedding issues either which this is designed to fix.I love this stuff!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Unbelievable
Review: It stopped my fallout and breakage COLD with the first use.I love it!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: Smells good make a lot of lather with one drop

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: The 5 reasons you should buy this!
Review: Smells good. Sulfate free. Sodium chloride free. 92% - 96% less breakage in 1 use. No petroleum or mineral oil. There, 5 reasons it got a 5 star rating and the 5 reasons its an HG shampoo for me.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Five Stars
Review: Love this shampoo

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Terrible products! I want a refund!!!!
Review: Did not help my hair at all. Definitely would not buy again. I wish I could get a refund. I spent over $100 on these Carol's Daughter products. DO NOT PURCHASE!!!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Something is Off
Review: I have used this product forever.  This time I bought it from Amazon as opposed to buying it from the manufacturer.  Something is off - the product color is different and the smell is different.  Leading me to conclude that either the manufacturer has changed it or this is not a legitimate product.  Not happy and will order directly from now on.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: My daughter's and I love the smell of this shampoo.
Review: I bought quite a few bottles of the shampoo during the holidays when they were on sale. The price was worth it. Now they're just too expensive. Definitely have to wait till they're on sale again.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: TOO SMELLY!!
Review: Opened it for the first time and wow the scent is wonderful....until it never. Went. Away!! TWO DAYS later, the scent is still so strong! It’s giving me a headache, I’m embarrassed to go out shopping because people act like I poured perfume all over my body, my husband is annoyed... it’s really bad. Look at the ingredients lists. The conditioner has PERFUME (aka toxic fragrance) as the 4th or 5th ingredient. This is not a safer or less toxic product but I thought if it worked I would look past that. Nope, definitely not worth it!Also, my hair does NOT break less and using both the shampoo and conditioner makes the ends of my hair staticky and the roots get oily. Not impressed and extremely disappointed considering how very expensive this is!

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Report abuse
Review: I was somewhat skeptical when I read the reviews and then saw the price (and size) of this shampoo.The shampoo is very nice (lightweight, manageable, shiny and healthy) and you only need a tiny amount as the shampoo is very thick and a little goes a long way.

Product: Carol's Daughter Monoi Sulfate-free Shampoo, 8.5 oz
Title: Report abuse
Review: Feliz de encontrar esta linea acá, espero puedan traer también el acondicionador ): jejeEs para cabello dañado/seco, lo que más resalto de este shampoo es su olor, es delicioso y perdura en tu cabello practicamente todo el día. Con poquito producto es suficiente, lo recomiendo.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Best conditioner I’ve used
Review: My hair is very fine and brittle. I was getting a little sad thinking that I wouldn’t be able to have long hair because of how brittle it has become as I got older (I used to have long, thicker hair as a child but as I went into my 20s it thinned our from stress and stuff).  This stuff is amazing, even after the first use it blew me away with how soft my hair became. It’s now been over two weeks of use and I have to say this conditioner has made me love my hair again. For those skeptics, I was not paid or given a free bottle. My mom bought it and showed me, and I felt the need to hop on her amazon and review it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Perfect for my 3c/4a natural curls
Review: I have african hair. I've tried almost every product natural curlies recommend and this is really the only one that works for  me (even if it's technically not CG friendly). Yes, this product does have silicone, but silicones are pretty much like a plastic you coat your hair with so it slips and slides and untangles more easily. Most curlies would say this is a bad thing, but considering how healthy my hair looks, how soft it is, how tight and frizzless my curls are, I say whatever!  I use "low poo" so for every 3 or 4 times I cowash only, I'll do a bit of shampoo to get the build up off, and I use the accompanying shampoo to this product. I absolutely swear by this conditioner and I have it on subscription because I cannot live without it! Too bad they're so hard to find in stores now!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: 3c / 4a Very High Porosity With S pattern curls
Review: I have a very odd hair type and I haven’t been this loyal to a conditioner since the relaxer days. It is the only product on my subscribe and save!  I really need this!  Can’t recall this much slip in years.  A must for natural hair.  In the pic, I washed, used THIS conditioner, and styled with Carols daughter Hair milk and a little of the Dudleys PCA moisture retainer. When it dries it will hold my curls together. So much better than using gels for the wash and go.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Horrible fragrance, left my curls breaking and like straw
Review: I used the shampoo and conditioner, both of which have such a terrible fragrance that I almost stopped and re-washed with my husband's shampoo/conditioner. This product smells something like overpowering, cheap baby-powder perfume and 4-day unwashed scalp. It is gaggingly cloying and sweet. I have never been so revolted. And the scent lingers even after a few days, even after I tried washing with my husband's product.The shampoo... well, it did clean. It completely stripped everything from my hair, including all of the moisture. So much so that I could barely get my hands through my hair to distribute the conditioner which barely contributed anything to my hair except a greasy feeling that I couldn't wait to rinse out.It left my soft curls brittle, like dry straw. I'm still trying to repair the damage that was done by one wash.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Miracle? Nah, but my hair is soft now
Review: My hair has been bleached, toned, and dyed to oblivion. I used to have soft, but tangle-prone loose curls, but after one bad bleach job, it never recovered. Frizzed out, tangled constantly, and in general unappealing, my hair has been through tons of treatments and conditioners. After just one wash using this conditioner, my hair hasn't been this soft in years. It is still frizzy, and still gets tangled, as this isn't a miracle product, but I can actually run my hand through it without feeling like I'm touching hay. Carol's Daughter has some great stuff, but this is the first that's truly landed home for me. Unfortunately though, the almond scent is not my favorite, haha

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Odd smell, but soft hair in exchange
Review: I was looking for a cheap alternative for an almond based conditioner, because my hair has gone through bleach and coloring. My hair is naturally pin straight, but tons of breakage because of how fine/thin it naturally is as well. Even though the smell is not the greatest, it actually fades after my hair dries, and I usually spray a little bit of leave-in-conditioner afterwards which masks the smell anyways. I would only say buy this if you are looking to repair damaged and thin hair for a cheaper price, but if you cannot stand a weird smell, then don't buy it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Softens Hair w/o Drying Out
Review: My hair has been flourishing tremendously since using this product.  Packaged properly, so that product stayed secure while in route.  Not a heavy product.  I have natural hair, which I recently chopped off.  My wash day process includes 1. using the conditioner as sort of a detangler, prior to washing my hair 2. Shampoo w/ product in the same family or apple cider vinegar rinse (with essential oil--rosemary) 3. Add more conditioner, after shampooing or cider rinse....leave in with cap 5 to 10 minutes 4. Rinse, use a small amount of leave-in moisturizer (Carol's Daughter's Hair Milk) or something similar 5. Style and go

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Product is nice but bottle wasn’t full.
Review: I wish I would’ve taken a picture when I first got it because the bottle wasn’t completely full. Doesn’t seem like it spilled in transit just as if it wasn’t full in the first place. The pump is abnormally large but.. I guess that’s not a huge deal. Product itself smells amazing and definitely moisturizes.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Never Going Back!
Review: I was using products that caused my hair to fall out.  I bought the whole system...shampoo, conditioner and deep conditioner (as will as hair mild and hair pudding).  Since using these products, my hair is softer and it is growing back! I won't using any other products on my hair!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Best thing is the scent!
Review: This conditioner isn’t special in any way. It isn’t the best at conditioning and definitely isn’t chemical free. The only thing that is appealing about this stuff is the incredible fragrance.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Transformed and Defined My Natural Curly Texture
Review: This is the best conditioner I have ever used. My hair is naturally in loose curls and is quite thick. It’s the type of hair that tangles sitting still. I also do not blow dry, straighten, or heat treat in any way and it has never been colored. I have been unhappy with my texture lately. It seemed limp and lackluster and my curls were undefined and there were less than usual. I started using Carroll’s Daughter and within only a couple uses, my texture was transformed back to it’s normal state. My curls are far more defined and the natural oils are no longer being stripped. I have way more volume too. It has truly surpassed my expectations. I can’t imagine buying another brand now that I’ve tried this one.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: PSA - Too much protein will kill your hair. This product caused severe damage to my hair.
Review: This will wreck your hair. I wash and condition only once or twice a week and because of the amount of protein in this shampoo and conditioner (which is not clearly marked on the bottle) my healthy-ish hair went to complete rubbish. Keratin and protein should only be used every once in a blue moon on hair, not on a regular basis. A protein overload will cause extreme damage. I just had to cut my hair to correct the damage that this product caused. This might work for African American hair IF they only wash every 4-6 weeks or less, but if you just have coarse, curly Caucasian hair like me, this will absolutely ruin it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Love this conditioner! And smells heavenly!
Review: I have a confession to make. It's a dry, scaly, scalp. I have tried every treatment out there from dandruff shampoo, to tar and coal based shampoos. From perfumed shampoos, to stinky stuff. From conditioners that are left in and those that are rinsed off, to oils and rinses. Nothing has cured my ails.Well, sorry, neither has this one! (Betcha thought I was going to say this one has cured me! Ha ha) I wish I could. I really do! Because this stuff left my hair so fabulous feeling!!! I mean really!Okay, so maybe I am comparing apples to oranges here (heck, who are we kidding? I know I am!) Conditioner is not meant to be a scalp treatment, but rather a hair treatment. Now am I right, or am I right? Of course it is. And Carols Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner  does just that! It restores natural luster and shine to your hair. And I have very white, 50-something, wiry hair. It is very thick. And very hard to get to look soft and shining. I do not color my hair because I don't like how it feels. But this, well, it brought back luster to my hair that I had been missing for a long time. I simply use a small amount each time I wash my hair, and it makes my hair shine! It also does something I was totally amazed to find it do. It took the fading yellow out of my hair! If you've ever seen someone with white hair, you may have noticed that sometimes it turns a yellowy-looking color. I don't know if that's something environmental, or pigment trying to return, or what. (I'm sure there's a logical explanation for that yellowy look.) I'm not sure. But I know it makes it look dingy. Something someone who works in the public eye doesn't like to see! This conditioner allows my white to shine! And for me, that sold me on the product!So I highly recommend Carols Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner, and I give it five stars,and a big thumbs up!You can find Carols Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner  on Amazon it retails for $11.37 for a 12-fluid ounce bottle. And it comes with a convenient pump bottle.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is very excellent conditioner.  My hair is "slightly" damaged from highlighting, meaning it gets tangled easily especially when wet. I don't like to comb it when it is tangled because it breaks. I try to treat my hair gently. This conditioner works great for me. My hair untangles in the shower, and it becomes smooth and comb-able.The product is thick and creamy. It has a luxurious feel. It expands with water to fill up your hair, and then rinses out cleanly.  It isn't slimy, and it doesn't leave a film on your neck.I think the conditioner smells very nice.  It has a kind of old-fashioned smell. I don't know if I am smelling the almonds in the almond milk, or if it is all added fragrance, but it does smell good, and not like chemicals.My hair handles great after using this product. It is easy to comb out and dry and style. After drying, it feels soft and full. It doesn't feel dirty at the end of the day, like with some other products.In general, I like to mix up conditioners. I don't stick to a single brand for very long, because I find the ingredients build up in my hair over time. So I will buy different brands and alternate them. I really like the Carols Daughter conditioner, so this one will go in my regular rotation.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Great Fragerance, Shine, and Volume
Review: My wife really loves the smell of this -- she loves to inhale deep when near my hair.  The fragrance is what some might consider feminine.  It reminds me of a mix between baby powder and a flowery lotion mixed together.  As long as my wife likes it, I don't mind my hair smelling a little baby powder.  The conditioner also produces a nice shine on my hair once my hair is dry and the volume looks improved too.  Further, my hair lays well and there is little frizz.  The pump is nice as it is designed in a way that water will not likely get back into the bottle.  You'd be surprised how often I've had this problem with flip-style lids.  Ingredient list uses a very small font which is frustrating given there was plenty of more room on the bottle in case they switched to a larger font.  The bottle slightly leaked upon delivery, but as I am in Arizona, the summer heat may have had a role in this.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is an amazing product. I have a 4c curl pattern and natural hair and use this daily. It leaves my hair feeling soft and manageable and has a wonderful scent!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Smells Horrible!
Review: I can't tell you if this product works because I had to wash it out almost immediately to get the horrible smell out of my hair. I thought the smell would fade as my hair dried, but it was just as bad as when I was putting it on my hair. Before my hair was even dry, I washed it again two more times with two different shampoos, and still couldn't get the smell out, but at least it had faded a bit. I lived with it for two days, and washed my hair again. It took one more wash after that to get the smell out completely. I had to put the towel that I had used initially out in the garage until I could wash it, and I put the shampoo bottle outside until garbage day, at which time, I threw it in the truck myself.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Carols Daughter Almond Milk Restoring conditioner
Review: As I understand it, Carol’s daughter is an L’Oréal, multi-cultural brand. Their website seems to be targeted toward a certain ethnicity.I have fine, naturally curly, Caucasian hair which isn’t really over-processed but I’m willing to try any product which might be an improvement.The conditioner has a subtle fragrance and left my hair easy to manage, just about what you’d expect from a conditioner.After being impressed by other Carol’s daughter products I was surprised that this conditioner was sort of mediocre. Nothing outstanding, one way or another.  In my opinion it is just OK (3 stars) .

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Liked product but expensive and borders on false advertising
Review: I really liked this product. It did a good job conditioning and getting the tangles out. Also think it has a light pleasant smell. It is quite pricey for the amount you get... I assumed that was because it was all natural ingredients. It is nearly impossible to pronounce the many ingredients and they are printed so tiny it is difficult to even read them. I was disappointed that this product seems to give an impression of an all natural healthy product but in reality is made with all the stuff you'd find in Suave or any other low cost conditioner.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I tested the Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner in conjunction with the Rhassoul Clay shampoo. I have used this product for the past few weeks and the results have been positive. As a man, I do find it to have a strong perfume sweet smell and can be a little overwhelming for a guy. It has a pleasant scent but More fitting for a female.  Scent stays with you for a long time. The Conditioner has a thick creamy texture. After rinsing out and drying my hair it was very soft. Combed nicely. Was over all pleased with the product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz

What I enjoy the most is that it hasn't made my hair heavy every day.  The price point for the performance is on point, and it's free from artificial colors which is something I was looking for.  I still prefer my Kenra conditioners, but this was a nice change of pace and is not bad for the price!  It definitely works better than the average drug store formula.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have fine, wavy hair that is color-treated and heat-styled. This conditioner made a big difference in just one use. My hair felt much silkier and smoother and I received comments about how healthy it looked, even though it has gotten long. I tried to avoid putting too much near my roots which can make them look oily. I see this more as a deep-conditioning treatment. The only thing I didn't like was the scent. Thankful it doesn't seem to linger after my hair dries.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This is a little too heavy for me for daily use, but perfect for weekly/monthly deep conditioning. Leaves hair feeling incredibly soft and smooth in a way that seems to last, long after use -- even after additional washings.This is made for processed, damaged hair and is especially emollient. It also smells really nice, without being overpowering.My sister-in-law, who has very thick hair that tends to be dry, swears by Carol's Daughter products.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Restores My Hair ...
Review: Restores My Hair ...... when I smooth my naturally curly hair with heat/hot tools. Although I go naturally curly most of the time, I do like to change it up sometimes. This line of the Carols Daughter brand is great for keeping my hair in great condition. I use it BEFORE I straighten my curls and after having worn the straighter styles.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: over-processed hair it works great for me
Review: I have normal hair that for the most part is not frizzy. Even though this conditioner says it is for damaged, over-processed hair it works great for me. I like the way my hair feels and styles after using this product.  Also I like the pump container. For me the only take away (1 star) is the fragrance. Just made me think of suntan lotion.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: works for swimmers hair
Review: I go swimming a few times a week and am always looking for conditioner to save my hair. This stuff works best if left on for about 5 mins. The package was broken when I received it and it took vinegar to get it off my hands. I am not used to fragrance and this is a little stronger than I like. My hair is better after a few uses.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Best conditioner ever
Review: I love this product

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: A very nice conditioner. It leaves my hair (colored, wavy, and tending toward dryness and tangling) soft and smoother. I like the way it feels afterwards, although I wouldn't use it everyday--once or twice a week seems best. I like the way it smells. All in all, a good product, at least for hair like mine.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The pump bottle is nice, convenient and easy to use. The conditioner is good for everyday, not too rich, easy to rub into your hair and rinse out. Seems to make hair softer. It does contain fragrance, and I don't like the smell that much - it smells like almond or maybe vanilla. But it's not too bad.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Good conditioner
Review: Even though the shampoo made my hair extremely hard this conditioner put in the moisture that the shampoo washed out of my curls. It also smells really good. I will purchase this again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Very strong, cloying scent
Review: I could not get over the oppressive smell of this product. I had to wash it out it was so sickly sweet. WAY too much scent for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Baby fresh
Review: After using this with the spray my hair seems bouncier and much more shiny. The smell is also great, as long as you like baby powder/vanilla

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Smells terrible
Review: Awful. Smells horrible. My son told my daughter that she smelled like a grandmother when using this stuff.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I'm not a fan of this conditioner. It weighs down my curls and smells very strongly of baby powder and perfume.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: scent is too strong for me
Review: the scent is too strong and synthetic smelling for me. While i was spraying it into my hair, it also smelled like hairspray. I found that a leave in conditioner works better for my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Low porosity approved!
Review: I’ve been looking for a replacement for my Shea moisture baobab low porosity conditioner and this conditioner works well. It’s not better than the discounted Shea moisture’s conditioner, but this conditioner works close to it. I warm it up and add oil to it and it adds a really nice slip to my 4c hair. I do recommend to my low porosity sisters

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Great for curly girls!
Review: I have thick, 2b/2c, low-porosity curls. My hair has been super dry lately so I went on a hunt to find a better conditioner. The smell reminds me of cherries and my hair feels softer after I use it. It's also pretty thick. Compared to some of the more well known curly hair products, this is a fantastic option for the price. I'd definitely buy it again.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: The truth 100%
Review: Love this stuff it does what it's supposed to do moisturizer, thicken, grow WOW better get you some

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz
Title: Works well for color treated hair
Review: Works well for color treated hair, Does not cause hair to be way down,

Review: gave it a try a few times. left my hair more tangled and knotted than before. smells good though, i’ll use it to shave my legs or something. maybe it’s just my hair type but it’s a no from me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Almond Milk Restoring Conditioner for Extremely Damaged Hair and Over Processed Hair, 12 fl oz , 12 fl oz

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Does NOT help with detangling
Review: I'm not sure I have ever seen a leave in conditioner that does not help with the detangling process but this one did NOT. Least not for me. I am black and I have used other Carol's Daughter products and have good results with them but this ... I was so mad after spending almost 10 mins (felt like an hour) trying to comb through my hair and running into tangles. I will never buy this again and can not recommend it - at all!!!! It was the worst leave in conditioner I have ever used. And to be honest it costs way too much to be this awful of a product

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Wanted to Love it.
Review: I've always loved this product and was excited to see it online.  However, something seems off. Must be a different formulation than the I used in the past. The fragrance is familiar but I find it heavy and somewhat sticky...Not loving it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: I love love this stuff
Review: I love love this stuff. !  The smell is amazing.  I smell my hair all day long.  This is by far the best leave in conditioner shine spray I have tried.  It is NOT greasy and doesn’t make my hair limp.  I have tried many from salons,  ulta you name it.You will love this ! I put it on wet hair when I get out of shower.  Controls my frizz and makes my hair so soft.  I also use on dry bed head  .i have long hair past my chest.  You will love this !!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Heavenly
Review: I absolutely love this product, as well as the shampoo and conditioner. My hair fell out due to a stylist wrongly overprocessing my hair. I left that stylist, found another, and only recently visited my new stylist due to the pandemic. With the aid  of the monoi products, my hair  is shoulder length. I must add that I also use a bit of cream-based oil, and I wash my hair on a regular basus.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Not sure what happened but nothing like Moni’s product line. Dried my hair out
Review: Very disappointed in this leave in. I love the whole line of moni carols daughter. But i had never tried the leave in. I use it on my deep wave brazilian weave. It totally dried the hair out with no moisture at all. I wonder of this was truly made by the product line or has been altered by the seller. I only say this because all of moni’s products are wonderful. So im not sure of this product is true to its ingredients or been altered

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: great product
Review: great product but i need another leave in as well, this is good to give a boost of hydration to ur hair when its dry but i use another more nourishing one while its damp cuz this on its own isnt enough. its a really good spray though and the smell is soooo nice

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Favorite, light weight

I don't put a lot of chemicals in my hair but I make an exception for this. I lightly spray my hair (locs) about 2 -3 times per week. This oil is light. It doesn't leave any sticky residue. My hair is just soft with a very light scent which dissipates quickly.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The design and packaging of the spray bottle looks promising. Ingredients and instructions are clearing stated for its purpose which is repairing our hairs. It did that, but not a full pleasant process in my experience.I am not a stranger to leave-in hair treatments or conditioners.  I have used a few brands in the market in the past 5 years because my hairs are naturally thin and dry. I need leave-in conditioner to protect my hairs under the brutal sun and this product achieved that. I tried it for 2 days and it kept my hairs moist and shine under the sun and my hairs could be combed and styled easily after my sleep without shampooing and hairdryer. That preserve the natural oil for my scalp and no unnecessary heat torture for my hairs in the morning. It also saved me time and money.  My hairs look healthier due to the added shiny layer and they also seem to be more straight than usual and I am happy with that.However, the scent from this leave-in conditioner is a little funky. I guess it is a either you love it or hate it thing. I was pleasant in the beginning, but it lingered all day and it made me feel annoyed by it. Also, my coworkers in office could pick up the scent near by easily and they kept asking what was that smell. It doesn’t stink or anything, but it doesn’t make me feel comfortable that people know that it is on my hairs. I am still using it, but I will only use it on stay home weekends and staycations.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I had really high hopes for this product. I typically use a professional quality leave-in conditioner, but I have used more affordable leave-in conditioners in the past so I can make a fair comparison. This product feels like it should cost half the asking price of $19.The first thing that stands out about this product is the awful smell. It's horrible. I use this on wet hair and the smell stays noticeable until my hair dries. Once dry, I don't notice the scent anymore. Once you get over the smell, the product just doesn't stand up to the claims that it makes. It states that it will detangle hair, and add shine, softness, and manageability. It doesn't detangle at all. It does add shine, but it's greasy and if you touch your hair, the product comes off on your hands even after hours. As far as adding manageability to my hair, it seemed to hold heat styling for longer with this product, but I had to clean my straightener and curling iron after using them when I had this product on my hair.Overall, I wouldn't recommend this. It doesn't detangle, it adds grease and weight to hair, and it makes your styling tools filthy.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I generally like this brand, but this was a bit of a miss for me. It smells great, but it did little in the way of moisturizing my thick-but-fine, tangle-prone, dry blonde hair. I tried it after my shower with nothing else; it didn't help me get through the tangles at all, and my hair air-dried a bit frizzy and dry looking. I tried it before my usual styling product, and the results were no different than if I had just used my stuff alone. I did find that it works well as a shine spray, or as an extra dose of moisture, on dry hair. It doesn't make a lot of difference, but it does impart a nice scent, makes my hair look shinier, and makes it feel slicker (and less tangle prone), at least for a couple of hours (I was back to tangles by day's end).For some reason it seems like this product doesn't penetrate my hair properly; it seems to just sit on it until it dries up. That makes it a nice finishing product, but not a good leave-in (at all) for me.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a very nice leave in conditioner. It can be applied to wet hair as a detangler or to dry hair to refresh your hair. I usually use it after I showered and I have to admit, this made my hair feel amazing. I brushed right through it without a tangle in sight! It also has a very pleasant scent that I just can't identify what it smells like, so it must be that monoi oil since I am not sure what that would smell like, but I REALLY like it a lot. The smell lingers for a bit and I wouldn't mind smelling it for a lot longer than it did.Once my hair was dry it looked beautiful. It was nice and shiny, did not look greasy, heavy or limp. I was very happy with how it looked and felt, very nice and soft just the way I like it. You don't need a lot of it either which is great since it isn't the cheapest, but also not the most expensive product I own.Fantastic product that I am very happy I found and will be repeat purchasing!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: For years I have bleached my hair and because of this I have very damaged and dry split ends. I have to apply a leave in conditioner every time I take a shower because if I don't I can't even run my brush through my hair. This is a decent leave in hair conditioner that untangles my hair and helps it feel more soft and manageable. It gives my hair a little shine and what I love most about it is the smell it leaves behind, even after my hair has dried.I have used many leave in hair conditioners over the years and find this one to be pretty good.  This isn't as effective as some of the higher priced brands but his fair for the price. I do notice that this leaves my hair feeling like a bit of residue is Left Behind when I use it though so make sure to only use a little bit.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Smells amazing!!
Review: I have used the monoi shampoo and conditioner from Carol's daughter for over 6 years and it makes my fine long straight hair feel so smooth and shiny. The smell is absolutely stunning, coconut and Jasmine flowers. I was so excited to get a chance to try this. It is a unique product, a cross between detangler, leave in treatment, and hair oil. It smells exactly like the shampoo and conditioner. I use it every morning to style my hair without the greasy buildup. The sprayer makes it easy to use, and if you don't do much with your hair other than brush it out and put it up, this is a Time saver since it smoothes your hair and makes your hair look more sleek and put together by sleeking and smoothing flyaways. I'll be using this to the last drop. Will definitely be getting more in the future.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Wifey has had some difficulties with her hair of late and has been trying different things to help. Here is her experience with this conditioner:Sometimes being on different medications it will affect and damage your hair by weakening it and making it brittle. After a long barrage of them, this had happened to me. So I was hoping that using Carol’s Daughter Monoi Leave-in Conditioner would help. I know that nothing is a 100 percent cure but it did help make it softer and shinier. I like that you could use it on your hair whether it is wet or dry, I will say that I was concerned when I first sprayed it on dry hair it did have a greasy look until it dried and was very soft. I will continue to use the product long enough to verify whether there is an improvement or not.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: don’t know what in this set off a sneezing frenzy but, something in it does within a minute and it does not matter if i spray it on (which i though why i kept sneezing the first time) nor matter if i spray in into my hand and put it into my hair that way, i end up sneezing away.. The fragrant may just be the culprit, it is 4th in ingredients and super perfume-y (fragrant is also listed again towards end as well).. It did make the frizzy tamed down without needing a lot and gave my hair (caucasian hair) a smooth shiny look so if strong fragrant product isn’t an issue for you, you may like this.Not recommend for those that get sinus migraines from strong perfume/chemical smells..

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This Carol’s Daughter Monoi leave-in conditioner works well. I have dry, over-processed, frizzy hair, and it really smoothed out the frizzies and helped to make my hair look tamer and less dry. It did also seem to make it stronger. This is just what I was looking for. Instead of silicones, there are oils in here, such as Tiare Gardenia flower, monoi oil, and Coconut Oil to hydrate and condition the hair. There is also wheat protein and vitamin B5 to strengthen and nourish it. This does not feel greasy or oily. There is no petrolatum, mineral oil, or artificial color. All I do is spray it on my hair when needed, and comb through. I did not notice any scent in this product.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I absolutely love this leave in conditioner. The scent alone will have you coming back for more. I have dry, damaged, color treated, long hair and this is uhmazing! I spray on when my hair is damp and it keeps everything feeling and looking so much more healthy, especially the ends! My hair is softer and more manageable now. I also spray on when my hair is dry when I feel like I need just a little bit of moisture and to freshen up. This is an amazing product that I will definitely purchase again! Great stuff

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: First unfortunately the bottle leaked during delivery. It was all over the inside of the package. Be careful when you open it. I love the product. It smells great (like gardenia lotion). I love how I can spray it on my hair in the morning and still smell it on there when I go to bed at night. I've been using it for several weeks and my hair seems softer and healthier than when I started with it. I just spray a couple of times after my shower and then massage it in. My hair is not all tangled up and i can run a brush through it easily then. I only use a little bit each time so I'm guessing this will last me a long time. Very happy about that!

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: So, I'm torn about this review.  I LOVE Carol's Daughter products.  I really do.  But it is very hard to determine if this product does all that it claims after just a few uses AND not using it with other brands products.  I love leave-in conditioners.  When I applied this it was like other spray leave-ins.  Easy to apply and moisturized my hair.  As far as the repair and al the other claims, I'm just not sure.  I wouldn't not use it.  It did seem to add moisture to my natural 4-something type hair.  What I liked is that my hair felt moisturized AND I didn't have to have the ENTIRE product line to feel it.  Thank you.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I received an 8 ounce bottle of Carols daughters, leave in conditioner. The Leave-In Conditioner is supposed to add strength and restore natural moisture to your hair. The product contains a blend of the Tiare Gardenia Flower and Coprah Coconut Oil - plus Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5. Directions -Hold bottle 6-8 inches from hair and spray all over. Use on wet or dry hair to help detangle. Use on dry hair to refresh style. Don't rinse out. The conditioner smells like an overwhelming strong perfume. I am not fond of the smell. The conditioner is also a bit sticky. Overall, it's ok.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Works great
Review: This is a very good product so far. I've used it repeatedly over the past few weeks and it's been working well as a leave in conditioner. It helps so much with tangles and it leaves my hair with a nice healthy shine. It has so many natural ingredients and none of those damaging ones in so many other products. It seems to be working great and it smells delightful as well. I recommend it if you are looking for a good leave in conditioner that adds a little boost to your hair and makes it look refreshed and renewed.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This is by far the WORST leave-in conditioner I have EVER used! My hair is fine and I normally don't need a lot of conditioner to make it feel smooth and silky and to detangle so I was shocked when I first sprayed on this conditioner and could feel my hair getting drier and tougher and actually feeling brittle, like hay. The scent is terrible as well. It was so bad that I thought it must be my imagination so I tried again and nope. IT IS AWFUL!  My hair would have felt better using nothing at all! Awful. Just...awful.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Success depends on the hair cut. Adds body and texture. Smells nice.
Review: This would probably work well with a short layered  boyish hair style because it does add body and texture. My hair is fine, thick, and currently cut in a mid-neck length bob and it needs to be smooth and silky. After shampooing and wrapping my hair in a towel for about ten minutes I applied the product. I was pleased with it at that point because it made my hair easy to comb the tangles out of. But once dry I knew that this leave-in conditioner isn't right for my hair right now. The scent is nice.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really like Carols daughter products so when I seen a leave in conditioner I was super excited! This product has a light smell not too strong and powerful but it does leave a good scent behind. I washed my hair a few times and sprayed this in afterwards. I was able to run my fingers through my hair better and it didn’t leave a greasy shine behind like some leave in conditioners do. Also great price sometimes these products tend to be expensive so this was a steal.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: I did not like the scent
Review: This leave in conditioner is really nice - and detangles my hair really well. However I think the scent is overwhelming and somewhat old fashion - I am not a big fan of it.The spray is working really well to refresh second day hair. The sprayer is really good too and has a fine mist.The price is good. The only thing I wish that the scent was different or that is was fragrance free. It is hard to describe the scent but I am not liking it.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Carol's Daughter Monoi Repairing spray does a great job on my teen's hair. She has very curly, coiled and dry hair that is hard to manage. She tries a lot of products and some dry it out further. This conditioning spray makes her hair look and feel softer. The scent is very warm and pleasant and the scent lingers. It's a pleasant experience.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I usually love any product by Carol's Daughter, but this one did nothing for my hair.  In fact I found it made my hair a bit stiff so it was harder to untangle my hair.  It was weird.  It left my hands and hair feeling sticky.  I had to apply another leave in conditioner before I was able to untangle my hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: not great for fine hair
Review: This is a solid leave-in conditioner that will condition your hair and make it look shiny.  However, it's not great for fine hair like mine because it weighs it down.  Also, I like hair products that smell like herbal essence products.  Although this smells good, it doesn't compare to herbal essence.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Nice
Review: This is nice, but it didn't do much for my curls. I think it may be more for straight hair. Not sure really. All I know is that my curls did not curl well after using this.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This worked pretty well with the shampoo from the same maker.It’s not a heavy conditioner at all.It basically detangled my hair. It also left it really soft. It has a prominent scent.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Incredible results for naturally textured hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: GREAT PRODUCT!!! GREAT SELLER!!!!!!!
Review: FANTASTIC PRODUCT!!! Bought after a friend let me use and fell in love. Smell is amazing very fresh but not overwhelming and makes hair feel incredible!!! Definitely recommend and I received my order 3 days after purchasing.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: it’s not my favorite
Review: not sure if I liked it. it was nice to have a spray on leave in conditioner and just not worry about anything. not sure if it tangled my hair more even after reading the instructions.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Doesn't moisturize
Review: Does not moisturize AT ALL

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Leave-In Conditioner
Review: There are 3 products sold and reviewed on this page, this review is for the Leave-in Conditioner. This product works best for me as a hair tamer. I brush my long curly clean hair out, spray on, and then brush through it tames the fly-aways without leaving a stiff hairspray feel. I didn't find the scent at all memorable nor did it detangle my hair (luckily I had rinse out conditioner for that). It did not leave my hair dry or brittle but it didn't make it any softer either.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Great for hair regimen
Review: All her products are great for healthy hair.

Product: Carol’s Daughter Monoi Repairing Leave In Conditioner with Monoi Oil, Wheat Protein and Pro-Vitamin B5, 8 fl oz
Title: Report abuse
Review: Super hidratante
